Allergic reaction- characterized by hives and flushing and anaphylactic reaction (throat and mouth swelling); Allergic reaction- characterized by hives and flushing and anaphylactic reaction (throat and mouth swelling); Allergic reaction- characterized by hives and flushing and anaphylactic reaction (throat and mouth swelling); Allergic reaction- characterized by hives and flushing and anaphylactic reaction (throat and mouth swelling); Allergic reaction- characterized by hives and flushing and anaphylactic reaction (throat and mouth swelling); Allergic reaction- characterized by hives and flushing and anaphylactic reaction (throat and mouth swelling); This is the spontaneous report received from a contactable other health professional. This other HCP (patient) reported for herself that a 30-year-old female patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: ER8727) at the age of 30-years, via an unspecified route of administration in left arm on 19Mar2021 13:00 at single dose for COVID-19 immunization, in hospital. Medical history included PTSD, anorexia, chronic migraines, bradycardia. Patient was not pregnancy at time of vaccination. Prior to vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. Concomitant medications included propranolol, atorvastatin (LIPITOR), prazosin, alprazolam (XANAX). On 19Mar2021 13:15, the patient experienced allergic reaction-characterized by hives and flushing and anaphylactic reaction (throat and mouth swelling). After medical treatment, hives continued for 3-4 days. The events result in doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit. The patient received high dose diphenhydramine hydrochloride (BENADRYL) and epinephrine (EPIPEN). Outcome of the events was recovered in 2021. Since the vaccination, the patient has not been tested for COVID-19.; Sender's Comments: Based on the information available and a close temporal association, a possible contributory role of the suspect BNT162B2 cannot be excluded for the reported events of Allergic reaction, Anaphylactic reaction. The case will be reassessed once new information is available. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to regulatory authorities, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate
30 2021-05-12 shortness of breath hard to hear at times; horrible pain from head to toe; couldn't see anything; couldn't breathe at al... Read more
Close
hard to hear at times; horrible pain from head to toe; couldn't see anything; couldn't breathe at all; face turned green; fever; aching in her legs; extreme exhaustion; blacking out; diarrhea; sweating; unable to talk; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer. A 30-year-old female patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Left on 06Apr2021 12:00 (Batch/Lot Number: EW0150) as 1st dose, single, at the age of 30-years-old for COVID-19 immunization. The patient had no medical/family history and concomitant medications. The patient went to go get her second shot of Pfizer covid vaccine but they wouldn't give it to her based on her reactions to the first dose. They said there was a chance of anaphylaxis reaction to the second shot. The patient reported blacking out, diarrhea, sweating and unable to talk. She consulted with her healthcare professional regarding whether to get the second shot and they didn't know. She asked if her reactions were normal. She doesn't know what to do whether to get a second shot given her reaction. It was mentioned that the patient was hard to hear at times. She got the vaccine on 06Apr2021 around noon and she was fine until around 3:30 am. She woke up in horrible pain from head to toe, she thought maybe she just needed to pee, she didn't know what was going on. She stood up and she blacked out like she was about to faint. She couldn't see anything, like it was completely black. She got to bathroom and she couldn't breathe at all, she couldn't talk. She thought she needs to go to the hospital, but she couldn't talk. Her face turned green, she had diarrhea, she was like dripping wet. At this point, she could sort of breathe. She felt like she was being held under water, still dripping sweat. She has recovered completely from these symptoms. The severity of symptoms was so severe she doesn't know if she had a fever at the same time, it was hard to tell. With the breathing part, she was so freaked out by that, so it's hard to know for sure, maybe yes. She may have had a low fever. She had a fever that night to the point where she was dripping on the floor. She has aching in her legs. She went to the doctor thinking she had Lyme disease, which she doesn't. Since that vaccine, she's had very, somewhat severe leg aches and extreme exhaustion like all the time. she can hardly go to work sometimes. Everybody has days they are tired, but this was different. She had to come home at 2pm and lay down for like five hours. She stated it was persisting. She had a blood test recently and everything came back perfect on 26Apr2021. She thought she had Lyme disease because of all the symptoms she was having, and it all came back negative. She didn't exactly get turned away. They said they didn't feel comfortable giving her the second dose of vaccine. The patient stated if a nurse tells her they don't feel comfortable, she wouldn't feel comfortable until she speaks to Pfizer. The nurse told her she had to go to an allergist and rheumatologist. The nurse said the same thing, the nurse told her that she should have gone to the hospital, but she wasn't thinking at that moment. She was just at a loss of what to do. That day at the hospital, they were scared with the second vaccine that she could go into anaphylaxis and she's not sure what to do. The patient had no other vaccines administered on the same date of Pfizer suspect and no other vaccinations within 4 weeks. The event hard to hear at times started on an unknown date while other events started on 07Apr2021 and ended the same day. The outcome of the events aching in her legs and exhaustion was not recovered, hard to hear at times was unknown while for other events was recovered. The events "she blacked out, like she was about to faint" was assessed as serious medically significant. No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information expected.

31 2021-01-08 shortness of breath Developed a "scratchy throat approximately 20 minutes post vaccination. Symptoms worsened and she de... Read more
Close
Developed a "scratchy throat approximately 20 minutes post vaccination. Symptoms worsened and she developed shortness of breath. Required evaluation and treatment in the Emergency Department. Received Benadryl, dexamethaxone, famotidine and solumedrol. Second COVID vaccine, no reaction with the first vaccine. ED provider notes below: This patient presented due to concern for allergic reaction to COVID-19 vaccine and was seen by myself immediately upon arrival. When in triage the triage nurse noted her oxygen saturation was 81% so she was placed on 2 L nasal cannula and brought directly back to her room. When placed in the room she was hooked up to the monitor and her oxygen saturation was 100% and I took her off of the nasal cannula and her oxygen saturation remained in the upper 90s. She had no stridor and respirations were nonlabored. She was speaking without difficulty and had no vocal changes. She did not appear to be in any acute distress. Her posterior oropharynx was widely patent and she had no uvula or tongue swelling or lip swelling. She did have some blotchiness to the upper chest area but no hives. Abdomen was soft and nontender. Pulse was regular. Blood pressure was stable. She was nontoxic in appearance. An IV was established and the patient was given Decadron and Benadryl for initial treatment.

The patient experienced dyspnea and chest tightness several minutes after receiving the shot. She did not notify anyone, and after her 15 minute wait, she went home. Her respiratory symptoms worsened despite taking a dose of diphenhydramine. At the urging of her family, she went to the ER four hours later, where she was evaluated. No treatment was done, and she was told that she was having a mild reaction. Her symptoms resolved after several hours.

After my first dose, the only symptom I had was soreness at the injection site lasting 1 day. 12 hours after my second vaccine, I developed muscle aches and chills that were gone the following morning when I woke up. 3 days after receiving my second dose, I developed hives and swelling on my entire body that progressed over 2 days. I also started to have some swelling in my throat by 4 days after the second dose and ended up going to immediate care for a steroid injection which began to provide relief by the next morning.
31 2021-01-12 respiratory rate increased Pt developed post COVID vaccine side effects at 1000. Pt received COVID vaccine at 0932 by LVN. ... Read more
Close
Pt developed post COVID vaccine side effects at 1000. Pt received COVID vaccine at 0932 by LVN. Pt complained of a numb throat, and said, "I cant seem to swallow my saliva well." This writer did an immediate assessment of patient's throat with flashlight, and no swelling, abnormal discharge, or discoloration noted. Pulse-ox that was available on hand was used on pt, and sats were 96% and HR 78. MA on site was asked to grab a complete VS machine for somewhere stat, for there was none on site. This writer reassured pt was going to be okay and to breathe normally, for assessed pt was breathing fast. This writer called every doctor listed on the "Contact List for COVID Vaccine Clinic," but there was no response. This writer then called Urgent Care and Minor Injury Clinic, but the doctors were busy with patients. Asked MAs from those areas to have a doctor call immediately for a patient here was symptomatic. Once VS got here, VS were taken, and pt was assessed again. Pt said there was no more numbness in her throat, but tongue was feeling itchy, and her body temp went from hot to cold. Intitial VS: Temp: 98.3 BP: 122/80 HR: 77 O2: 99% RR: 18 Dr from Urgent Care finally called. Background story given, and she ordered Diphenhydramine Cap 25mg (Benadryl) which this writer had on hand in the emergency kit. Order was on computer, but could not acknowledge or scan, so order detail was printed, and pt and I signed form together. Benadryl given at 1025. Dr also suggested that ID doctor be called. At 1030, I got a hold of Dr., gave her a background story, and she advised that the pt stay for another 30 mins to be observed and she would come see the pt. Dr. arrived at 1100, assessed the patient, and ordered Cetrizine Tab 10mg (Zyrtec) to give to pt, which Dr. had to get from another department. There was no Zyrtec available in emergency kit. Again, order was on computer, but could not acknowledge or scan, so order detail was printed, and pt and I signed form together. Zyrtec given at 1128. An additional Zrytec Tab 10mg was given at same time at 1128 "for home use" per Dr and per her order. VS set #2 taken at 1133 Temp: 98.1 BP: 133/94 HR: 63 O2: 100% RR: 16 Dr suggested that she schedule an appt to see an allergist and to get an allergy test done prior to the next dose of the COVID vaccine. Patient was feeling a lot better and more at ease. Pt left comfortably with no symptoms at 1200.
31 2021-01-12 shortness of breath Side effects: headache, joint pain, muscle aches, fever, dizziness, nausea, shortness of breath, fat... Read more
Close
Side effects: headache, joint pain, muscle aches, fever, dizziness, nausea, shortness of breath, fatigue
31 2021-01-14 shortness of breath 1/12 0715: Received Pfizer covid-19 vaccine dose 2 at end of shift. Went home to sleep after waiting... Read more
Close
1/12 0715: Received Pfizer covid-19 vaccine dose 2 at end of shift. Went home to sleep after waiting 15 min. 1630: Woke up. Felt more tired than usual. 1900: Arrived at work. Felt fatigue and sore arm. 2000: Felt sore arm, fatigue, and mild HA. Drank coffee and this helped with fatigue and HA. 2100: Mild nausea starts. Still have sore arm. Less fatigue, no HA. Still able to eat with the nausea. 2200: Developed chills. I was putting up curtains in an isolation room and had to pause halfway through due to being short of breath as if I'd done something strenuous. I then was short of breath again walking specimens to lab, which is unusual for me. Walking samples to lab involves walking 400 ft and going up and down 1 flight of stairs. 2300: Coworkers keep asking me why I'm always out of breath. They are concerned. Chills are worse now and I go from feeling normal to feeling cold. My hands are like ice and I am gripping my arms to keep warm. I walk 2 samples to lab and each time I am dizzy on the way back. By the 2nd time I have to hold the wall to keep balance. I can no longer hide the side effects and a coworker offers me 650mg Tylenol. I gladly accept. I measure my spO2 and it is 97%. 1/13 0530: I am almost back to normal other than feeling fatigued. 0815: I get home and go to bed. My feet are ice cold so I have to wear socks, but my hands feel normal temperature. I feel like my blanket isn't warm enough. 1330: I wake up and feel absolutely miserable. I am going between having chills to having a hot flash. I can't seem to will myself to leave bed. I'm pretty sure I have a fever, which I haven't had in over 10 years. My mouth is completely dry. 1400: I manage to roll out of bed and take my temperature, which is 101.3F. I feel an overall malaise and keep getting periodic hot flashes, but manage to make it downstairs and I mix 1 liquid IV electrolyte packet w/ 24fl oz. water. I drank the whole thing. I also cooked myself some dumplings and 1 waffle w/ maple syrup due to feeling much hungrier than usual. 1430: I take 1000mg Extra Strength Tylenol after eating. 1830: I feel almost normal except for significant fatigue and go to bed. 1/14 0430: I wake up and feel completely normal. No fatigue. Go about my day as normal. 1545: Suddenly I feel lightheadedness and mild HA. Have trouble with inattention (ex. not following w/ conversation or forgetting what people just said, or listening but not registering, or can't find the words to respond or answers to a question.). I take my Vitals: 117/95, spO2 85%, HR 63. I then try taking a couple deep breaths and spO2 increases to 98% and lightheadedness and HA go away. Then a few minutes later lightheadedness and HA begin again and spO2 is 80-90%. Then I take 2 deep breaths and spO2 is 98% and HA and dizziness improves. This repeats several times and I grow concerned. My hands are cold and the pulse oximeter is $30 from Amazon. However, I used the pulse ox on my mother and she was 97% consistently every time without fail. I also used pulse ox on myself when perfectly healthy and same thing it was 98%+ every time. This is why I was now worried. 1630: I take Tylenol since this seems to have helped with any and every symptom I've had so far and book an Urgent Care appointment. 1700: I get up to take a shower and feel extremely dizzy to the point where I'm worried I might fall. I stumble into the bathroom holding the wall. I take spO2 and it is 87%. 1800: I show up to Urgent Care and after the shower I feel my hands are warm now. At Urgent Care they are using pulse oximeters and I am spO2 99% and HR 64. So they chalk it up to my crappy Amazon pulse ox and they tell me to hang in there. Perhaps if I had not taken a shower before going there it may have been a different story? Hard to say now. Also the Tylenol may have started to work by then. 2200: I am still inattentive, spacey, lightheaded, and fatigued. I then fell asleep on the couch without realizing. 1/15 0230: I wake up and feel fatigued with brain fog, but no more lightheadedness. 0630: I go back to bed because I'm too sleepy.
31 2021-01-15 painful respiration, shortness of breath flu like symptoms, shortness of breath, chest pain with deep inspiration, fatigue, malaise, body ach... Read more
Close
flu like symptoms, shortness of breath, chest pain with deep inspiration, fatigue, malaise, body aches
31 2021-01-16 shortness of breath generalized body aches, shortness of breath, extreme fatigue, headache
31 2021-01-18 shortness of breath, throat tightness Approximately 15-20 minutes post-injection I started to feel lightheaded, dizzy, shaky and increased... Read more
Close
Approximately 15-20 minutes post-injection I started to feel lightheaded, dizzy, shaky and increased heart rate. This was swiftly followed by a feeling of tightness in my throat, shortness of breath, and coughing. In addition I had a moderate to severe headache. The hospitals rapid response team was called and I was brought to the emergency department on-site. I was given a racemic epinephrine and albuterol neb treatment which resolved upper airway stridor and cough. I received PO Benadryl, Pepcid, and Prednisone. A EKG was completed. I was observed in the emergency department for about 2 hours until discharge. I was discharged with prescriptions for an Epi-Pen, Prednisone, and Pepcid. The diagnosis on my after visit summary was: Allergic Reaction. I was unable to finish my scheduled shift as an RN.
31 2021-01-18 shortness of breath shortness breath, chest pain and abdominal hives

Close
Approximately 10 to 15 minutes post injection she started feeling hot, then patient began to become flushed . I gave her oral benadryl 50 mg and 40 mg of famotidine oral. The difficulty in breathing did not lessen. She began to use her accessory muscles. Her O2 sats were 99% via finger pulse oximeter. Breathing became increasingly labored. An Epi pen 0.3 mg was administered. An ambulance was called. Her breathing became less labored, she was transported to the hospital via ambulance to be checked out.

COVID-19 test done on 1/13/2021 due to severity of symptoms, was negative. 3 days later (1/15/2021) left calf pain with mild edema, subsequently diagnosed (1/20/2021) as a left posterior tibialis complete vein occlusion (DVT). Chest CT done to rule out pulmonary emboli. Anticoagulation prescribed (xarelto).

Close
About 15 minutes after receiving vaccine symptoms started. Nauseous, dizziness, chest pain, shortness of breath, body aches (extreme), joint pain especially in hips and knees, extreme fatigue, headaches, ears constantly rang. Rash on my arm where I received it went down to my elbow and up to my shoulder and on to my upper back, about 3 hours for it show up. It red, raised and bumpy and it felt hot. This lasted for 4 days. I was very pale and my eyes were sunken in. I literally felt like I was ran over by a vehicle. I was sleeping for about 15 hours a day. I kept getting chills then I profusely sweats then it switch to freezing cold and back and forth between the two. I took Tylenol and Benadryl to control symptoms but still felt miserable. The symptoms all stayed with me to the end. I still do not feel 100%, I am still having ringing of the ears, moderate body aches and headaches. Someone else said they still see the rash but I cannot really tell. I was also having trouble focusing for a few days after receiving the vaccine, I felt highly medicated not the fun high the bad high

31 2021-01-24 very rapid breathing ED notes as follows: 31 y.o. female who arrived to the emergency department for Vaccine reaction. ... Read more
Close
ED notes as follows: 31 y.o. female who arrived to the emergency department for Vaccine reaction. The patient presented to the ED after getting her second COVID vaccination. She reports feeling confused, nauseous, and having a racing heart. She has never had a reaction like this before. She reports having a tickling sensation in the back of her throat and both hands feel like they are tingling. The patient denies any other known allergies. The patient has a past medical history of anxiety, depression, PTSD, prior conversion disorder. Patient denies any shortness of breath or chest pain but does report a headache. The patient denies any drug use, alcohol use, tobacco use. Patient has no other complaints at this time. The patient was given Benadryl, Epi, solumedrol, for anaphylactic-like presentation. Patient also began on fluids and Zofran for possible vaccine reaction. Patient symptoms began to improve over the course few hours. At the 3-1/2-hour mark after initial arrival to emergency department the patient began to have similar symptoms to her initial presentation with tachycardia, dry heaving, and finger tingling. The patient was also hyperventilating. The patient was given 1 mg Ativan which relieved her tachycardia had resolved her hyperventilation signifying possible anxiety component to symptoms. Patient was allowed to relax for 20 to 30 minutes at which time she was comfortable and felt like she was okay to discharge home. Patient was instructed to follow-up with her primary care doctor that she could next week. Patient was informed to return to emergency department if new symptoms arise or current symptoms worsen. Dispo: Discharge home with PCP follow up on Monday Initial Vital Signs [01/22/21 1424] Blood Pressure 161/99 Heart Rate 112 Respiratory Rate 24 Temp 36.4 °C (97.6 °F) Temp src Oral SpO2 99 %
31 2021-01-25 throat swelling Injection site immediately felt severe itchy following injection but diminished after approx. 30-45 ... Read more
Close
Injection site immediately felt severe itchy following injection but diminished after approx. 30-45 minutes. I then felt fine until exactly 3:00 pm (approx. 3 hours following injection). I stood up and immediately felt like passing out. I had excruciating cramping throughout my legs and horrible joint pain in my knees. By 3:30 I had hives covering my right hand- my hand was also very red and swollen and had severe itching/burning. By now I also had horrific joint and muscle pains all over my entire body and the leg cramping was even worse. the hives responded well two doses of Benadryl and the muscle aches somewhat improved with rotation of ibuprofen and Tylenol. By 5:00 am the following day, the joint and muscle pains were worse. My entire body felt like it was on fire and I had excruciating pain in my throat. It was difficult to speak or swallow and I could feel my throat swollen on the inside. My neck was also slightly swollen and the lymph nodes on the left side of my neck were in horrific pain but not swollen. I continued doses of Benadryl, ibuprofen and Tylenol all day and night and slept most of the time. By Sunday Morning, my throat felt even worse and I had 100 degree fever and continued body aches and joint pain. I was seen at a local urgent care who ran various tests (see below) that were negative and advised me to treat as if it were an allergic reaction and go to ER if I got any worse. Fever and pain improved by Monday and by Tuesday I was able to return to work but with significant fatigue and continued pain in my legs. I continued to improve throughout the week. Now the following week I overall feel back to normal other than I have continued leg pain, esp. in my knees by the end of the day.
31 2021-01-26 shortness of breath Severe rigors involving core and extremities, making it difficult to breathe.; Severe rigors involvi... Read more
Close
Severe rigors involving core and extremities, making it difficult to breathe.; Severe rigors involving core and extremities, making it difficult to breathe.; muscle pain; joint pain noted in hips; loss of appetite; profound fatigue; This is a spontaneous report from a non-contactable nurse (patient). A 31-year-old female patient received the second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE; lot: EK9231, expiry: unknown), via an unspecified route of administration on 11Jan2021 11:45 on the left arm at a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. The patient received the vaccine in a hospital. The patient had no other vaccine in four weeks. Medical history included clinical depression. The patient has no known allergies. The patient was not tested for COVID prior and post vaccination. Concomitant medications included bupropion and multivitamin. The patient previously took the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE; lot: EK5730, expiry: unknown) on 21Dec2020 at 11:00 in the right arm for COVID-19 immunization. On 12Jan2021 at 01:00, the patient experienced severe rigors involving core and extremities, making it difficult to breathe. Flexeril 10 mg was taken to help relieve rigors. Rigors stopped and ease of breathing resumed in 1 hour. Other symptoms include muscle pain, joint pain noted in hips, loss of appetite, and profound fatigue x48 hrs. The events difficult breathing, muscle pain, joint pain noted in hips, loss of appetite and profound fatigue were not treated. The outcome of the events was recovering. No follow-up attempts are possible. No further information is expected.; Sender's Comments: Based on the compatible temporal association, the vaccination with BNT162B2 might play a contributory role in triggering the onset of "severe rigors involving core and extremities, making it difficult to breathe". The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees and Investigators, as appropriate.

Within thirty minutes of administration I started feeling itchy around injection site then all over my entire body. I stated to have some facial swelling then my throat started to swell/tighten. I was brought to the ED and an IV was started. They administered IV fluids, Benadryl, Prednisone, and Pepcid. The throat swelling started to interfere with my speaking and vocals. They monitored me for 7 hours then I was discharged home. All symptoms returned within a few hours and persisted for a week following. My PCP took over care and prescribed me the following in replace of the medications the ER prescribed: Albuterol HFA, Dexamethasome, Pepcid, Benadryl, Z-Pak, Vitamin D 100,000iu, and Fish Oil. I missed a week of week then was released to work again on 1/25/21.

Struggle to balance. 18:00: At Urgent Care spO2 is 99%, HR 64. Her hands are no longer cold. 22:00: Still dizzy. Sleep. On 15Jan2021 at 02:30: Still lightheaded & fatigued, but no balance issues. 06:30: Sleep. 15:00: Mild fatigue. Events resulted in Emergency room/department or urgent care. No other vaccine in four weeks. No COVID prior vaccination. No COVID tested post vaccination. Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of the events. The outcome of the events was recovered on an unspecified date in Jan2021.

I was feeling SOB at work, but by the end of the day I would have to sit down and catch my breath. I didn't feel like I was getting enough oxygen. I was light headed. Heart rate was in 160s, Respiration was in the 60s, Carbon Dioxide was 11 and pulse ox was around 7%. They did EKG , CT Scan and they gave you oral Benzo. They told me that I probably got the vaccine too soon after COVID diagnosis, which I had in Dec.

31 2021-02-25 shortness of breath Light cough; Shortness of breath; Anaphylaxis; lost voice entirely; This is a spontaneous report fro... Read more
Close
Light cough; Shortness of breath; Anaphylaxis; lost voice entirely; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 31-year-old female patient received the 1st dose of bnt162b2 (BNT162B2, Manufacturer Pfizer-BioNTech), via an unspecified route of administration, on 11Feb2021 at 13:15, at single dose, for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history was none. Patient did not have known allergies and did not have COVID-19 prior to vaccination. Concomitant medications included piroxicam (PAXIL) and lisdexamfetamine mesilate (VYVANSE). Patient did not receive other vaccines in four weeks. The patient experienced light cough on 11Feb2021 at 14:45 with outcome of recovering, shortness of breath on 11Feb2021 with outcome of recovering, anaphylaxis on 11Feb2021 with outcome of recovering, lost voice entirely on 11Feb2021 with outcome of recovering. The events required emergency room visit and physician office visit. The patient was hospitalized due to the events in Feb2021 for 1 day. Events were considered life threatening. Clinical course: light cough after half an hour from vaccination. Within 2 to 3 hours had lost voice entirely and was suffering from shortness of breath. Her primary physician told her to go to the emergency room or he was calling an ambulance because he said it sounded like anaphylaxis and that her life was in danger. Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of the events and included treatment with intravenous (IV) Decadron Pepcid and epinephrine. She received the 2nd dose on 21Feb2021 at 01:15 PM. Patient was not tested for COVID-19 post vaccination. The information on the lot/batch number has been requested.

Close

Took two pumps of rescue inhaler and took out Epi Pen. 2 Mins later: called for help, nurse gave patient provided EpiPen (I was shaking too much to inject myself), additional Epi from crash cart, non rebreather O2. Symptoms included: convulsions; dizziness; bronchospasms; throat closure; difficulty breathing; dry heaving.

At 10:35 I started feeling weird in my body like when I get either an asthma attack or flu type. It was an hour later when I first began to feel lightheaded, dizzy, chills, and then really cold. I tried to settle down and not panic to make things worse on my asthma attack. I then had to lay down feel weak. Within the next 15-20 min I used my nebulizer at home to help me breathe. After one treatment it helped me tremendously but still felt tired, nauseous, fatigue, pounding headache, but no fever since I barely checked at 98.5.

pt return to store approximately 40 minutes ( per pt) after receiving the vaccine and told us that she felt a knot in her throat and her lower lip was swollen and felt numb. Took pt into the vaccination room, took her blood pressure ( 125/82). There was no rash or hives. Pt was alert, oriented but complained that her throat still felt tight and there was a knot. Pt was asked to remove the mask so we could check for edema. Her lower lip appeared very swollen. We told her that it could be an allergic reaction and needed to administer the EpiPen and call 911- pt received 1 dose of epi pen 0.3mg into the left thigh through clothing at aroung 12:30 pm .We called 911 and continued to monitor patient while waiting for EMs to arrive. Her second BP was 122/75 after the EpiPen and she said the knot was still in her throat. EMS arrived very shortly after and took over. They told her that they would take her to a hospital to monitor her.

EMS was on site and immediately took her to their EMS truck for evaluation. Her vital signs were BP : 120/80 Pulse: 76, and Sats: 98%, and she expressed that she is a mouth breather. She was given 25mg of Benadryl and a bottle of water to sip on. At 2:20pm participate stated that she felt fine and was checked out to go home. Woke up feeling nauseous/diarrhea at 1 am on Wednesday (approx. 60 hours after injection). Side note- on Tuesday (day after injection), I donated blood. Not sure if this is relevant. After waking up nauseous, I experience extreme shortness of breath and full body chills for roughly 30 seconds to 1 minute. I walked about 10 steps to wake up my partner and fainted instead. I woke up to him calling my name, and almost immediately threw up. Afterwards, I felt okay, only tired and a little weak. 31 2021-03-31 throat swelling Anaphylaxis; Swelling/tightness of the throat and chest; Swelling/tightness of the throat and chest;... Read more
Close
Anaphylaxis; Swelling/tightness of the throat and chest; Swelling/tightness of the throat and chest; Swelling of the tongue; numbness of the tongue; persistent disorientation; confusion; Rapid heartbeat; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient herself). A 31-year-old female patient received her first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: EN6207), via an unspecified route of administration in left arm on 17Mar2021 as a single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included rheumatoid arthritis (RA) and asthma. The patient had no known medical allergens. Concomitant medications in two weeks included amoxicillin, clavulanic acid (AMOXCLAV 875-125 MG) and cetirizine hydrochloride (ZYRTEC 10 MG). The patient did not receive other vaccines in four weeks. The patient was not pregnant and was not diagnosed with COVID prior to vaccination. On 17Mar2021 12:15 PM, the patient experienced anaphylaxis, swelling/tightness of the throat and chest, swelling of the tongue, numbness of the tongue, persistent disorientation and confusion, and rapid heartbeat. The events resulted in doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit, emergency room/department or urgent care, life threatening illness (immediate risk of death from the event). Treatment included 2 Epipens, Benadryl 25 mg, and intravenous Benadryl. Outcome of the events was not recovered. The patient was not tested for COVID post vaccination.
31 2021-04-08 throat tightness, shortness of breath convulsions; bronchospasms; throat closure; difficulty breathing; Felt an "aura"; joints loosening; ... Read more
Close
convulsions; bronchospasms; throat closure; difficulty breathing; Felt an "aura"; joints loosening; dizziness; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable nurse (patient). A 31-year-old female patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE) at the age of 31-year-old, via an unspecified route of administration, administered in left deltoid on 26Feb2021 15:15 (Lot Number: EN6202) as single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included known allergies to opioids, Toradol, Valium, and a lot of foods; mast cell activation disorder, eosinophilic oesophagitis (EoE), asthma, celiac disease, Hashimoto, and hypothyroidism. The patient was not pregnant at the time of vaccination. Concomitant medications included montelukast sodium (SINGULAIR), levocetirizine dihydrochloride (XYZAL), meloxicam (MOBIC), paracetamol (TYLENOL), and levothyroxine sodium (SYNTHROID); all taken for an unspecified indication, start and stop date were not reported. It was reported that one min later after the vaccination (26Feb2021 15:16), the patient felt an "aura" (joints loosening, dizziness), gave herself two puffs of albuterol and pulled out her epi pen and called for help. Two mins later (26Feb2021 15:17), the patient experienced convulsions, bronchospasms, throat closure, dizziness, difficulty breathing. Two rounds of epi, non-rebreather O2, rescue efforts. The patient was then transferred to emergency department (ED) to continue rescue efforts. The patient was treated with O2, Ativan, Steroids, Epinephrine, and Benadryl. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included Covid nasal swab PCR test: negative on 26Feb2021 (post vaccination). The patient was recovering from the events.; Sender's Comments: Considering temporal relationship, a possible contribution role of vaccination with the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE) to the onset of the reported events, cannot be completely excluded. The case will be reassessed should additional information become available. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees and Investigators, as appropriate.

31 2021-04-12 rapid breathing, shortness of breath Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine EUA: soon after vaccination patient reported throat itching. Parame... Read more
Close
Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine EUA: soon after vaccination patient reported throat itching. Paramedic administered oral diphenhydramine twice at vaccination site. Patient then reported chest pain, shortness of breath, urticaria, and increased throat scratching. Paramedics administered epinephrine twice and methylprednisolone and transported to emergency department (ED). On arrival to the ED patient still reported chest tightness, numbness, and was tachycardic (pulse 122 beats per minute), tachypneic (26 breaths per minute), and hypertensive (blood pressure 139/85). In the ED patient experienced more difficultly breathing and epinephrine continuous infusion was started. Laryngoscopy did not document evidence of airway compromise. Patient diagnosed with possible anaphylaxis and admitted (currently still hospitalized).
31 2021-04-12 shortness of breath fainted; having an odd taste in my mouth; shortness of breath/breathing took 40 minutes to return to... Read more
Close
fainted; having an odd taste in my mouth; shortness of breath/breathing took 40 minutes to return to normal; vasovagal syncope response; the expected sore injection site; headache; felt overheated; could quite literally only see stars; This is a spontaneous report from a non-contactable consumer (patient). A 31-year-old female patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Right on 04Apr2021 10:45 (Lot Number: ER8732) as single dose for covid-19 immunisation. Medical history included hypoglycaemia (she ate before the injection) and fainting. Concomitant medication(s) included Birth control and prednisolone acetate ophthalmic sus. The patient did not receive other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. 5 minutes after the injection, the patient began having an odd taste in mouth, shortness of breath, and she fainted. She had a history of fainting, but it took longer for her to recover than usual (50 minutes instead of 15). When she regained consciousness a few minutes after, she had a headache, felt overheated, and could quite literally only see stars. Her breathing took 40 minutes to return to normal, and her body temperature took 2 hours to feel normal. She assumed this was mostly a vasovagal syncope response, but she wasn't anxious or in pain beforehand. After 6 hours, she still have the odd taste, a headache, and the expected sore injection site. The events resulted in Doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit. Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of the events included Paramedic took vitals and monitored for an hour. The outcome of the events was recovered with sequelae. Prior to vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19. No follow-up attempts are possible. No further information is expected.

Then Monday 1/11 in the early morning I started to develop a rash on my b/l elbow and right foot 3rd toe. I applied mometasone topical cream to these locations. while at work the rash extended down both forearms then by 5pm it was on both hips and extending along both legs. I applied Benadryl cream to the most irritated sites and took PO Benadryl 50mg at bedtime and again at 1am when the itching woke me up. I repeated Benadryl 25mg at 8am. The rash seems to be getting better on the arms but then by noon I had a new breakout on my neck and face. I took Benadryl 50mg at 1pm. The rash continued to have a rapid progression over the next hour and resulted in angioedema with my throat swelling, lips puffed and numb and eye swelling. I was injected with an epi pen and sent to the ED where I received PO prednisone, famotidine, and Benadryl. The face/neck rash then greatly improved and I was sent home on prednisone 40mg daily for 3 days.

A 32-year-old female patient started to receive bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number EH9899), via an unspecified route of administration from 08Jan2021 to 08Jan2021 at a single dose for an unspecified indication. Medical history was not reported. Concomitant medication included ascorbic acid, (VITAMIN C), ergocalciferol (VITAMIN D) and retinol palmitate (VITAMIN A). It was reported by the patient that she started feeling like her throat is scratchy and she looked at it in the mirror and it looks like really red. She got really thirsty so she started drinking a lot of water and she had some ice that she is chewing on. She felt like discomfort on the front of her throat and swelling; all occurred in 08Jan2021. The outcome of the events was unknown. Information about batch number has been requested.
32 2021-01-19 shortness of breath Patient reports that she did not have any issues after the first Covid19 Pfizer vaccine but 5 minute... Read more
Close
Patient reports that she did not have any issues after the first Covid19 Pfizer vaccine but 5 minute after her second dose she felt like it was hard to swallow. She attributed this to excitement from completing vaccine series and finished her 15 minute wait time. She went home but it became harder to swallow and she felt like her chest was "heavy" and she became short of breathe walking up stairs. She took fexofenadine 180mg and cetirizine 10mg and filed a report with the CDC. Her symptoms resolved and she slept. The morning after her vaccine she felt fine and went for a 6 mile run. She called vaccine clinic to see what kind of follow up she needed to completed and was asked to contact PCP and employee health. She presented to PCP that day (day after second vaccine) who reported ongoing symptoms of moderate chest tightness and some throat discomfort. Given prescription for Medrol dose pack, albuterol inhaler, and EpiPen and instructions on when to present for care.

Close
Pt received vaccine. She was sitting in the observation area after vaccine. About 10 minutes after vaccine, Pt reported feeling numbness in hands and feet, chest tightness and slight difficulty breathing. Pt was offered and ingested diphenhydramine 25mg at 1230 and another 25mg at 1238. Pt continued with same symptoms (not better and not worse). 911 ambulance was called. Pt remained conversing with full sentences with one breath during observation. Radial pulse was strong and regular. No rash. No apparent swelling. Respirations were quiet (no stridor). Ambulance arrived and took over care and eventually transported pt to the ETC.

Close
fever; shortness of breath; fatigue; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable other health professional (patient). A 32-year-old female (not pregnant) patient received second dose of bnt162b2, intramuscularly in right arm on 08Jan2021 16:00 at single dose for covid-19 immunization. The patient's medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. The patient previous received first dose of bnt162b2 on 18Dec2020 for covid-19 immunization and experienced fever. The patient experienced fever, shortness of breath, fatigue on 10Jan2021. No treatment received. The event resulted in doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included body temperature: 102.8 in Dec2020, body temperature: 100.5 in Jan2021, body temperature: 103 in Jan2021, nasal swab: negative on 13Jan2021 (COVID test result negative). About 20 hours after the first vaccine, she ran a fever to 102.8, lasted about 12 hours. She received the second vaccine and ran a 100.5 fever the following day. Her husband woke up with COVID 3 days after her vaccine, she also woke up with a fever of 103, 58 hours after my second dose. Associated with shortness of breath and fatigue. lasted 3 days. The outcome of events was resolving. No other vaccine in four weeks. No COVID prior vaccination. COVID test type post vaccination: Nasal Swab PCR (polymerase chain reaction) on 13Jan2021 with result negative. Information on the Lot/Batch number has been requested.

32 2021-01-29 throat tightness Patient came in for COVID vaccine she was in good spirits. After her vaccine, she started off with a... Read more
Close
Patient came in for COVID vaccine she was in good spirits. After her vaccine, she started off with a small cough that started to increase. She started to cough more at which time I requested my RN to come and evaluate her and Monitor her while I reached out to our ER which is attached. We moved the patient to the sleep lab while waiting for the ER to come up. Patient started complaining she felt that her throat was closing. Her O2 was stable at 98/99. Her HR was over 100 bpm. When the ER team came up and put her in a wheel chair her upper lip was swelling and her arm was blotchy. Patient did come up a few hours later to schedule her 2nd dose vaccine after she received a high dose IV Benadryl and Pepcid. She is going to speak to her PCP about this reaction and let me us know if she can take the 2nd dose.
32 2021-01-30 shortness of breath After first dose, arm soreness lasting 3 days, headache lasting an hour. After around 5 days, I thou... Read more
Close
After first dose, arm soreness lasting 3 days, headache lasting an hour. After around 5 days, I thought it was stress related, but I started to have itchiness on the roof of my mouth at the back. There is a kind of rashy area in the back of my mouth, mostly on the roof. It itches a lot and it makes my throat hurt when I attempt to scratch it. I have had to use chloraseptic spray and numbing cough drops to ease the itch and pain. Also, I have been experiencing shortness of breath. I attributed it to Chronic Bronchitis, but it feels different and is not constant. I didn't make the connection of mild allergic reaction until I received my second dose. I received my second dose on 01/29/2021. I was experiencing flu-like symptoms on 1/30, and am not experiencing the same symptoms as of 1/31. I am, however, still experiencing the mouth rash and itching, and mild shortness of breath.

32 2021-02-01 shortness of breath Saturday, January 23rd I received my second COVID vaccination around noon. Later that day I develope... Read more
Close
Saturday, January 23rd I received my second COVID vaccination around noon. Later that day I developed the typical extremely sore arm. Sunday January 24th: I started to feel just a general malaise and had some headaches, like I was coming down with something, but other than that felt fine. Monday January 25th: I was at work and started developing a sore throat, chest tightness with some shortness of breath, myalgias, fatigue, nausea, and minor chills, although I never had a fever. Tuesday: symptoms were slightly worse Wednesday January 27th: I went to work thinking all these symptoms were still just from the vaccine as I hadn't felt any sickness symptoms before getting the vaccine and hadn't had an exposure I was aware of. While at work, I asked other coworkers if they had any similar symptoms to the vaccine and was told I should call employee health since I was still having such bad symptoms and really didn't feel too great. I called the employee health line and told them all my current symptoms which were all the same still. They told me that the sore throat and chest tightness with shortness of breath were definitely not from the vaccine and to leave work and get tested. I did this and my test came back negative. Because I was still having bothersome chest tightness, the employee health line also told me to go to the ER, thinking it could be something else significant. I went to the ER the night of January 27th to get my symptoms all checked out as told to. Everything came back ok and the ER doctor wanted me tested for COVID again Friday around the 48 hour mark to verify it wasn't the virus. She also told me that if it came back negative, she was sure it must be my reaction to the vaccine. Thursday January 28th: I stayed home per guidelines from employee health and still had all the symptoms listed on Monday. After a two hour afternoon nap, I finally felt like I was turning the corner. My sore throat felt better besides a huge lump still in my throat and my chest tightness with shortness of breath subsided. I still had bad myalgias, fatigue, headaches and a general sense of not feeling so great. Friday, January 29th: Feeling slightly better again, main symptom is bad myalgias, especially my neck and small lump in throat. I got retested around 12:30 pm and it came back negative for COVID as well as negative for strep. Saturday: Feeling almost 100% better besides sore neck still.

Medical history included birth control. The patient has no known allergies. The patient was not pregnant at the time of vaccination. The patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19 prior to vaccination. Concomitant medication included ethinylestradiol, levonorgestrel (LEVORA) for birth control. The patient previously took the first doe of BNT162B2 on 31Dec2020 administered at the left arm. The patient got the vaccination on 22Jan2021 and in less than 5 minutes she started getting pins/needles/tingling/pain on both of my hands. Then suddenly her chest tightened and had difficult breathing which lasted for 2-3 mins. Now (22Jan2021), she has pins/needles/tingling/pain throughout her body. The events resulted in doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit. It was unknown if the patient received treatment for the events. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included Nasal Swab and SARS-CoV-2, RT-PCR on 21Jan2021 and both are negative. The outcome of the event general body pain was unknown and recovered for the rest of the events.

32 2021-02-11 throat tightness, shortness of breath Pt received second dose of Pfizer vaccination at 0910. At 0925, pt notified staff of intermittent fe... Read more
Close
Pt received second dose of Pfizer vaccination at 0910. At 0925, pt notified staff of intermittent feelings of shortness of breath and lightheadedness. Pt verbalized she had no intake for the morning was given apple juice and animal crackers. At 1015, pt reported to staff of continuing intermittent feelings of lightheadedness, shortness of breath and itching on the legs. Pt was transported to private area for further assessment via wheelchair and assisted to lie down on massage table. A provider on duty assessed pt at 1015 and administered Epipen at 1020 for potential allergic reaction. Pt reported to have taken Lorazepam (dose unknown) prior to appointment at 0905. Symptoms were discussed with pt and agreed to have EMS transport to ED for further monitoring. EMS was called and they transported pt to WW ED. 0925 Vitals: BP-108/64, P-64, O2-97%, Resp-20 1015 Vitals-BP-104/60, P-78, O2-100%, Resp-20 1035 Vitals-BP-124/68, P-80, O2-100%, Resp-20 Admin: Epinephrine (EPIPEN) 0.3mg/0.3 mL injection R thigh transported to ED next to clinic. ED COURSE & MEDICAL DECISION MAKING: 11:10 AM I met with the patient, obtained history, performed an initial exam, and discussed options and plan for treatment here in the ED. I was wearing PPE including N95 mask and face shield. 11:19 AM Paged allergist. 11:40 AM I discussed the patient with allergist from Fairview. He does not recommend any additional labs or treatment for the patient. 2:12 PM I rechecked on the patient and she is feeling better. We discussed the plan for discharge and the patient is agreeable. Reviewed supportive cares, symptomatic treatment, outpatient follow up, and reasons to return to the Emergency Department. Patient to be discharged by ED RN. Pertinent Labs & Imaging studies reviewed. (See chart for details) 32 y.o. adult presents to the Emergency Department for evaluation of allergic reaction. Had onset of symptoms within a few minutes of receiving her second Pfizer COVID-19 vaccination today. Symptoms seem consistent with allergic reaction including itching, hives, feeling lightheaded, nausea, and some abdominal cramping. She was given an EpiPen prior to arrival and brought here by EMS. There she was also given Benadryl, Solu-Medrol, and Pepcid. Other than some mild itching, did not have any return of other symptoms. Given prescriptions to continue with Claritin, Pepcid and prednisone. Also prescriptions for EpiPen was provided. Did briefly discuss with the allergist on call. No additional recommendations at this time. I do recommend that she follow-up with an allergist sometime the next few weeks. She was advised to return to the emergency department for any new or worsening symptoms or other concerns. At the conclusion of the encounter I discussed the results of all of the tests and the disposition. The questions were answered. The patient or family acknowledged understanding and was agreeable with the care plan. MEDICATIONS GIVEN IN THE EMERGENCY: Medications methylPREDNISolone sod suc(PF) injection 125 mg (Solu-MEDROL) (125 mg Intravenous Given 2/10/21 1135) diphenhydrAMINE injection 25 mg (BENADRYL) (25 mg Intravenous Given 2/10/21 1137) famotidine 20 mg injection (20 mg Intravenous Given 2/10/21 1138) Transported to ED by EMS. Symptoms seem comsistent with allergis reaction including itching, hives, feeling lightheaded, nausea, and some abdominal cramping. Given Benadryl, Solu-Medrol and Pepcid. Other than mild itching, did not have any return of other symptoms. Given prescriptions to continue with Claritin, Pepcid and prednisone. ALso given prescription for EpiPen. Did briefly discuss with allergist on call. No additional recommendations at this time. I do recommend that she follow-up with an allergist sometime the next few weeks. Pt returned to ED later in the evening reporting throat tightness and itching. Normal vitals and no objective signs of anaphylaxis. DC'd to home.

It was unknown if the patient was pregnant at the time of vaccination. The patient's concomitant medication was unknown. 32 2021-02-24 shortness of breath Within 2 minutes of vaccine receipt the patient became agitated. She was noted to have erythematous ... Read more
Close
Within 2 minutes of vaccine receipt the patient became agitated. She was noted to have erythematous macules on her upper back consistent with hives. Her heart rate and respiration rates were normal. She was observed initially as the family reported that she gets hives with all injections. However, about 2 minutes later she began to retch and stated that her throat was burning and she couldn't breathe. She was administered 0.3mg of epinephrine via an autoinjector. Her shortness of breath and throat burning symptoms resolved almost immediately. She was then given 10mg of Cetirizine PO and transported via local EMS for evaluation at the Hospital ED.

32 2021-02-25 shortness of breath PATIENT RECEIVED VACCINE; NOTED SHE HAD ALLERGY TO PENICILLIN/AMOXIL; COUNSELED TO WAIT 30 MINUTES A... Read more
Close
PATIENT RECEIVED VACCINE; NOTED SHE HAD ALLERGY TO PENICILLIN/AMOXIL; COUNSELED TO WAIT 30 MINUTES AFTER VACCINATION TO MAKE SURE SHE DOES NOT HAVE LATE ALLERGIC REACTION TO VACCINE. WHEN 30 MINUTES WAS OVER I ASKED THE PATIENT IF SHE WAS FEELING OKAY. SHE STATED "HER JOINTS FELT STIFF LIKE WHEN SHE TAKES AMOXICILLIN." QUESTIONED THE PATIENT IF SHE WAS LIGHTHEADED/DIZZY OR HAD TROUBLE BREATHING? PATIENT RESPONDED "NO, JUST ACHY JOINTS AND SWEATING." AT THAT POINT SHE HAD ANAPHYLACTIC SYMPTOMS. INFORMED PATIENT I COULD GIVE HER SOME TYLENOL FOR THE PAIN. TOLD HER TO GO HOME AND RELAX. INFORMED PATIENT I WOULD CALL HER IN 30 MINUTES TO CHECK IN. 30 MINUTES LATER I CALLED PATIENT AND NO ANSWER AND LEFT VOICE MAIL. 1 HOUR LATER CALLED AGAIN AND NO ANSWER AND LEFT ANOTHER VOICEMAIL. PATIENT CALLED 2-3 HOURS AFTER GOING HOME STATING SHE REPORTED TO "HOSPITAL." SAID SHE STARTED TO DEVELOP DIZZINESS, SWEATING, MORE JOINT PAIN, NAUSEA, AND SHORTNESS OF BREATH "BUT MAY BE DUE TO NERVOUSNESS." I ASKED PATIENT ABOUT RECONSIDERING SECOND DOSE OF VACCINE, BUT SHE THEN SAID "THE HOSPITAL STILL RECOMMENDS ME GETTING THE SECOND DOSE." THEREFORE LEADS ME TO BELIEVE IT WAS NOT A REAL IMMUNE RESPONSE BUT A PSYCHOLOGICAL RESPONSE. ANNOTATED IN PT PROFILE AND INSERTED ALLERGY TO PFIZER VACCINE IN PT PROFILE

Close
Swollen throat; headache; dizziness; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable healthcare professional (patient). A 32-year-old female patient received first dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: WL8982, expiry date not reported), via an unspecified route of administration at the left arm on 24Jan2021 10:15 at single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included food allergy (walnut and pecan allergies). Concomitant medications were not reported. On 24Jan2021, the patient experienced swollen throat, headache and dizziness. The patient was not pregnant at the time of vaccination. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. The patient was vaccinated at an urgent care center. The patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19 prior to vaccination. Since the vaccination, the patient has been tested for COVID-19. The adverse events resulted in a doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit. The adverse events resulted in emergency room/department or urgent care. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included SARS-COV-2 test: negative on 29Jan2021. Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of dizziness that included an anti dizziness medication. Clinical outcome of the events was not recovered.

32 2021-03-24 rapid breathing, shortness of breath The patient is a healthy 32 yo with a history of AE after Pfizer Covid vaccine #2 (lot #EL1284, rec... Read more
Close
The patient is a healthy 32 yo with a history of AE after Pfizer Covid vaccine #2 (lot #EL1284, receipt 06 January). She reports receipt of vaccine at about noon. She developed nausea about 30 minutes later. She developed headaache about 1-1 1/2 hours later. She fetl lethargy and fatigue about 4-5 pm and was asleep by 18:00. She slept through until noon the next day when her mother awoke her due to concern for her breathing pattern. She said she felt exhausted and unwell like 'a terrible hangover'. She could not stand and her limbs felt weak and flaccid. Family called the nurse help line who instructed to call EMS. She was soaked in sweat, but no fever and reports she was told her BP was elevated, her extremities were numb but tingled as they improved, and she recalls very severe headache and breathing was hard due to feeling 'heavy'. She felt better as she got near the hospital. She notes her recall of the events is hazy. She was treated with IVF and Toradol and discharged with tylenol, motrin and zofran. She denies emesis, but recalls severe myalgias, knee arthralgias which continued with fatigue for about 10 days, and still has discomfort to her right knee. She reports chest tightness with exertion, which resolved. She denies cough, diarrhea, or any immediate reaction suggestive of IgE. She reports local site reaction of erythematous plaque with smaller peripheral macules, centrally located at the injection site with smaller macules peripherally down her arm. She denies history of AE with other vaccines. Per ER notes, states EMS report HR 114, diaphoretic, HTN,, febrile, tachypneic, received 500 cc bolus. Triage states crying, anxious and tachypnic, guided in deep breathing, BP 95/65, HR 100, RR 26 sat 97%, T 98.3; documented as ill appearing. cc: fatigue, weakness, sweating, nausea, malaise, headache. Only diagnostic is EKG which was normal. She was treated with Ofirmev, in addition to IVF and Torrodol.

Close
Approximately 15 minutes after vaccine administration patient started to complain of bilateral upper extremity muscle aches. After another 20 minutes she noted that she was starting to have a sensation of her throat itching and closing. EMS was called. No acute distress noted. Patient speaking clearly and in full sentences. Airway patent and no swelling to neck, face or lips noted. Lungs clear bilaterally and moving air well. Skin warm and dry. Mild redness noted to upper chest. Patient evaluated by EMS and discharged. Patient monitored for an additional 10 minutes without incident. Patient still complained of upper body aches but stated that she felt ok to leave. She verbalized understanding to call 911 or go to ER if symptoms change or worsen. Attempted to call patient 12/31 @ 1741 for follow up. No answer, left message with guidance to continue to monitor symptoms and go to ER for any urgent concerns.

32 2021-05-03 throat tightness, shortness of breath I was admitted to the ER with a complex migraine and parathesia in my right arm; I was admitted to t... Read more
Close
I was admitted to the ER with a complex migraine and parathesia in my right arm; I was admitted to the ER with a complex migraine and parathesia in my right arm; after about three days of flu-like symptoms; after about three days of flu-like symptoms (nauseau, tiredness, body aches); after about three days of flu-like symptoms (nauseau, tiredness, body aches); after about three days of flu-like symptoms (nauseau, tiredness, body aches); My throat felt restricted; I had hives and raised bumps and bruising on my left arm where the shot went in; I had hives and raised bumps and bruising on my left arm where the shot went in; I was having difficulty breathing; my body felt like it was swelling up everywhere; allergy symptoms manifest/allergic reaction; I had the normal side effects of numbness and soreness in my left arm; I had the normal side effects of numbness and soreness in my left arm; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). This 32-year-old female patient (No pregnant) received 1st dose of BNT162B2 (Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine, Lot number: ER8737) on 05Apr2021 06:15 PM at single dose on Left arm for covid-19 immunization. Medical history was Immunocompromised, chronic migraines. Known allergies: Just seasonal allergies. Wheat and soy allergy, restricted diet. Concomitant medications (in two weeks) included fluticasone propionate (FLONASE) for allergies (nasal spray), mirtazapine (REMERON). No other vaccine in four weeks. Patient stated that I had the normal side effects of numbness and soreness in my left arm from 05Apr2021. Three days later I had allergy symptoms manifest, Thursday (the shot was on a Monday), and had to go get allergy medication. My throat felt restricted, I was having difficulty breathing, and my body felt like it was swelling up everywhere. I had hives and raised bumps and bruising on my left arm where the shot went in from 09Apr2021 ( reported as 08Apr2021 12:00 PM). Swelling noticeably went down after the allergy medication and breathing returned to normal. On Tuesday, 13Apr2021, after about three days of flu-like symptoms (nauseau, tiredness, body aches), I was admitted to the ER with a complex migraine and parathesia in my right arm, though the shot was in my left arm, and the migraine was in my left side of my head. I feel that this was an allergic reaction that happened belatedly and is a much stronger reaction than anyone else I have seen take the same dose and the same vaccine. AE resulted in Emergency room/department or urgent care. Treatment was Allergy medication from 08Apr2021 to 13Apr2021 two IV's + Benadryl. Outcome of the event was Recovering. No Covid prior vaccination. No Covid tested post vaccination. No follow-up attempts needed. No further information expected.

Received covid vaccine 1/2 at 2pm. Around 7pm that night, left arm pain and slight itching of whole body. did not think much of it. woke up once in middle of night at 4am with racing heart but went back to sleep. Around 9 am next morning started getting chills, initially mild then severe and developed severe myalgias; could not get out of bed or lift arms or limbs. having chest tightness and shortness of breath. pressing on chest wall hurts, hard to take deep breath. Temps of 99.5 most of morning. started taking tylenol total of 1 gram. 1 hour after tylenol shaking and rigors with sweating. had temp of 101 after tylenol. HR 110 at this time (my baseline is around 60s). O2 sat remained normal. Went to ER for testing for covid in case this was covid--test negative. Felt a little better morning of 1/4--no fever. tried to work 1/2 day; called out sick. lots of brain fog, fatigue mental slowing. still having intermittent chest tightness and sob; feel like i cannot expand my lungs. deep breath makes me cough. had few small red bumps on left antecubital fossa that resolved. i'm a physician, i'm concerned this was a severe reaction and was advised to report this.
33 2021-01-04 throat swelling tachycardia; dizziness; throat swelling; blotches on chest; palpitations; chest tightness/had residu... Read more
Close
tachycardia; dizziness; throat swelling; blotches on chest; palpitations; chest tightness/had residual mild chest discomfort and noticed 2 blotches on chest in car; metallic taste in mouth; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable physician (patient). A 33-year-old female patient received the 1st dose BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number EH9899) via Intramuscular on 28Dec2020 12:30 PM at single dose in the arm left for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included Bee venom (anaphylaxis), hereditary fructose intolerance (HFI, HFI as above but no previous issues with sucrose containing vaccines) and Known allergies: Bee venom (anaphylaxis). Concomitant medications included Linaclotide, Adderall, polyethylene glycol 3350. Roughly 5-7 minutes after injection, the patient experienced palpitations, chest tightness, and metallic taste in mouth - sensations mostly subsided after another 5 minutes so did not report. Left center after 30 mins, the patient had residual mild chest discomfort and noticed 2 blotches on chest in car. Drove home - on the way at 13: 15 (45 mins post vaccine), developed throat swelling, severe chest tightness, tachycardia (HR 130s), and dizziness. Severe symptoms (throat swelling particularly) subsided after 5 minutes but other symptoms persisted for another hour. Used albuterol, had epi pen ready but didn't use. Now 3 hours out, feeling close to baseline. The patient underwent lab tests, which included Covid test post vaccination with Negative result in Dec2020. The patient received treatment for events, which included Albuterol. Outcome of events was recovering.

33 2021-01-07 shortness of breath, throat swelling, throat tightness With in 10 mins of receiving 1st dose, I started to feel hot and light headed, my body became very ... Read more
Close
With in 10 mins of receiving 1st dose, I started to feel hot and light headed, my body became very hot, I started to sweat and then my throat started to dry up and close. I notified the provider on watch that was monitoring me during my 15 mins after injection and as the walked me to the room I became more and more dizzy, my throat continued to swell and close, my mask was removed where my face was covered with a rash and hives . The dr. Gave me 50 mg benedryl, and a shot of epinephrine. After wards 911 was called, my heart rate was eventually brought down with the epinephrine as my symptoms began to be controlled. An inhaler was administered because I was short of breath. 3 hours later I was stabilized. I then was recommended to go to urgent care rather the emergency room since the wait was 13 hours to be monitored at the local hospital MLK. I went to urgent care near my home at Hoag hospital and they monitored me and gave me a steroid injection IM. I was discharged with an epi pen just in case abs to take benedryl every 6 hours . The following morning 1/8/21, at 8 am the swelling of my throat retuned I became light headed abs my tongue became numb. I was taken to fountain valley hospital where an IV was started, 500 mg of iv benedryl, another epinephrine injection was given abs I remained under surveillance for another 6 hours. They stated that a lot of people are coming with reoccurring episodes of anaphylaxis after the phizer injection.

Then respirations were slowing and patient felt like she was going to pass out , like that pending doom sort of feeling. 33 2021-01-12 throat tightness, shortness of breath Pt got Pfizer injection around 6:19 PM. After 5 min, she c/o feeling dizziness "like drunk/seeing st... Read more
Close
Pt got Pfizer injection around 6:19 PM. After 5 min, she c/o feeling dizziness "like drunk/seeing star" as well feeling sob, throat tightness, sweaty hands. Has no PMHx. Not taking any medications Allergies: None. Denies any food allergies. Has gotten Flu shot yearly w/o any side effects. No prior allergic reaction to vaccines. Temp 98.4, BP 140/92 mm Hg, 142/87 mm Hg, HR 120 /min, 158 /min, RR 24 /min, Oxygen sat % 99 %. Exam: in acute distress, + erythema macular rash noted on forehead/periorbital region. Notice sweaty palms/hand tremors. Throat: a bit swollen tongue. Heart: sinus tachy. Lungs: no stridor, no intercostal retraction seen, clear to auscultation bilaterally, no wheezes, rales. Given Benadryl 50mg QD and Epi-pen (left thigh) and given 2 puff of Proventil inhaler. Pt drank 1-2 cups of water. Called 911. After Epi-pen, her HR trended down from 158 - > 120 - > 99 (in 1-2 min). Pt felt better, rash on her forehead/occipital region subsides after 10-15 min. Her shakiness of hand minimal. Her SpO2: 99 % (remains the same) Still feel a bit tightness of her throat (discomfort when swallowing). Her breathing is stable and talking w/o any discomfort by the time the ambulance came over. Her repeated BP: 142/87, HR: 99. I advised to take her to ER for close monitoring (risk of possible developing another reaction).(NEXT PAGE)

33 2021-01-13 shortness of breath, wheezing about 10 hours after administration, I developed SOB, mild chest pain, hoarseness, and right sided w... Read more
Close
about 10 hours after administration, I developed SOB, mild chest pain, hoarseness, and right sided wheezes. I self treated with albuterol (2 puffs) inhaler that I have on hand in case of environmental allergy triggers (I rarely have to use it- last use 3 years ago). The wheezing resolved and chest pain improved but the hoarseness remained. Over the next 2-3 hours I developed headache, malaise, mild dizziness, arthralgia, myalgia, and eventually fevers and chills (by 13 hours after vaccine administration). When fever reached 101 I self treated with naproxen 250mg. I slept for 4 hours and awoke diaphoretic, but the fever had resolved and I felt much better. However, I developed urticaria that started on my flexor surfaces of the elbows, hips, and knees, and spread to my adbomen, thighs, and face, with swelling about my right eye. I self treated with 25mg benadryl and itching and urticaria improved to the point that I was able to sleep. When I awoke the next morning my symptoms had largely resolved with the exception of mild headache, body aches, hoarseness, slight chest tightness, and mild residual swelling of the right eyelid.
33 2021-01-14 shortness of breath 12/20: 10 mins after the injection my arm started hurting so I was moving it around and suddenly a f... Read more
Close
12/20: 10 mins after the injection my arm started hurting so I was moving it around and suddenly a felt a tickle in my throat, swallowed and felt like I swallowed the wrong way and was coughing to the point of feeling like I was going to vomit. Per everyone around I was bright red and I looked weird. The ER nurse said my heart rate was 125 and my systolic BP was elevated at 130s (normally in the 110s). After sitting for 45 mins heart rate was back to 60s. Still felt like I was in a fog but felt ok. Once I walked to my car I felt alot of nausea again and was on and off the rest of the day. In the middle of the night I woke up short of breath laying on my back had to lay on my side. 12/21. I was moving pavers and got short of breath. Checked my heart rate and it was 100. O2 sat was 99%. If I sat and didn't move I was fine as soon as I started moving it started again. Also felt nauseating all day. I was having a hard time concentrating and my husband was getting frustrated that I wasn't understanding what he was saying. My left arm hurt really bad all day 12/22 By the afternoon felt more normal except my arm still hurting really bad. 12/26 was shoveling dirty and suddenly my arm where I got the injection started hurts and I got very nauseated again. On 12/29 the cdc called me because I did the vsafe program. They were wondering if I was actually going to get the second vaccination because they said my reaction is a severe reaction. 12/30 my arm started itching had chills and temp right after 1/1 rapid test was negative for covid 1/2 pcr was negative
33 2021-01-14 shortness of breath On Sun 12/27 around 12pm I had left arm tenderness and I was fatigued and then at 5pm I had a fever ... Read more
Close
On Sun 12/27 around 12pm I had left arm tenderness and I was fatigued and then at 5pm I had a fever starting at 99.5 and by 11pm 103.5 I had body aches chills, rigers, fever did not break with tylenol or advil . I had the fever until Monday afternoon and it broke for a few hours and came back and did not budge from 101. I called occupational health and asked questions about my fever, monday night at 8pm I had a bad dry cough and SOB and chest tightness and sinus congestion, no sneezing or runny nose, still with a fever. I called occupational health again and they said to come in to get covid tested and results were positive Tuesday 29th AM. On Thursday I started taking medicine: 5 day course of singulair, slow vent albuterol prn teflex antibiotic and calcium, Zinc and Vitamin D. The fever started to break around Monday the1st to the 4th around 99 to 100 . The 4th I lost sense of taste and smell and Monday the 28, 2020 I had neuromuscular pain in stiffness in legs and I had trouble walking and when fever got lower I realized I was having pain in my feet and hips. I think the infection triggered the unknown neuromuscular condition. I was supposed to go to work the 11th but since I was still having leg issues and my leave was extended one more week. I do not believe these reactions were due to the vaccine I think it was just a coincidence I contracted COVID prior to getting the vaccine

33 2021-01-14 shortness of breath had a metallic taste; turned to swollen tongue; hives around chest and neck; difficult to breathe; t... Read more
Close
had a metallic taste; turned to swollen tongue; hives around chest and neck; difficult to breathe; tachycardia; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable other HCP (Patient). A 33-year-old non-pregnant female received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number=EL 3248), via an unspecified route of administration at right arm on 07Jan2021 16:15 at single dose for covid-19 immunization. Vaccine was administered at hospital. Known allergies included cyclobenzaprine and dairy latex. Concomitant medication included amfetamine aspartate, amfetamine sulfate, dexamfetamine saccharate, dexamfetamine sulfate (ADDERALL) 10 mg, gabapentin 300 mg, venlafaxine 150 mg. No other vaccine in four weeks. Three minutes after vaccination the patient had a metallic taste, turned to swollen tongue, hives around chest and neck, difficult to breathe, and tachycardia on 07Jan2021 16:18. The events resulted in Emergency room/department or urgent care. Treatment received included Epinephrine, methylprednisolone sodium succinate (SOLU-ME dork) and famotidine (PEPCID) also diphenhydramine HCl (BENADRYL). The outcome of the events was unknown.; Sender's Comments: Based on temporal association, a possible contributory role of suspect BNT162B2 cannot be excluded for events metallic taste, swollen tongue, hives, difficulty breathing and tachycardia. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees and Investigators, as appropriate.

Close
Beginning one day post Pfizer COVID vaccine dose 2 on 1/9/21, experienced dyspnea /increased work of breathing with very mild exertion (i.e. ambulating around the house). Intermittently unable to talk in full sentences with ambulation one-day post administration. Shortness of breath generally resolved with sitting down, lasted 72 hours in total, and was accompanied by fatigue, chills, body aches, stomach cramps, and headache. Home pulse ox showed O2 saturation at 98% during periods of dyspnea, HR 100. Contacted primary care provider's office on day 3 post vaccine to notify of symptoms and determined COVID-19 test was clinically indicated. Test obtained day 4 post-vaccine with negative results. Of note, unable to report post vaccine side effect data in V-Safe day 1 post administration due to error in V-Safe system.

Approx. 5 min post administration recipient complained of not feeling well. On exam patient was bradycardic, diaphoretic, pale and altered. Patient appearance worsened, and level of responsiveness continued to decrease. Patient was hot and indicated difficulty breathing, and nodded in confirmation when asked if her throat felt tight. Patient given 0.3mg epinephrine IM via autoinjector in the right thigh. Patient condition improved rapidly and regained awareness. Patient transported to ER for ekg and monioting, discharged without incident.
