38 2021-01-26 throat swelling Within 2 minutes of receiving vaccine, patient reported experiencing throat swelling, face and lip t... Read more
Close
Within 2 minutes of receiving vaccine, patient reported experiencing throat swelling, face and lip tingling. Patient was administered diphenhydramine PO while in clinic. At this time, patient declined to be seen in the ED and was released from clinic after additional monitoring. Patient received a course of prednisone from another physician later that day. 2 days later the patient began experiencing severe abdominal pain and was seen in the ED. Labs, right upper quadrant ultrasound, and abdominal CT were within normal limits and was determined that symptoms were likely still part of COVID vaccine anaphylactic reaction. The patient was evaluated by the acute care surgery service who did not find anything concerning and was discharged home from the ED with return precautions and instructions to follow-up with primary physician. The patient follow-up with PCP and was continued on a 5 day course of steroids. The patient will not receive a second vaccine dose at this time and was referred to see an allergist for further testing.
38 2021-01-26 throat tightness, shortness of breath hot flash; arm was very sore at the injection site; diagnosed with an allergic reaction; This is a s... Read more
Close
hot flash; arm was very sore at the injection site; diagnosed with an allergic reaction; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable other healthcare professional (patient herself). A 38-year-old female patient (not pregnant) received first dose of bnt162b2 (BNT162B2 also reported as COVID 19, brand= Pfizer/Biontech, lot/batch number and expiry date were not reported), via an unspecified route of administration in the right arm on 11Jan2021 14:45 at SINGLE DOSE for Covid-19 vaccination. She received the vaccine in a facility. Medical history included gastrooesophageal reflux disease. No other vaccine in four weeks. Concomitant medications included ergocalciferol (VIT D) and lansoprazole (PREVACID). On 11Jan2021, within about 10 minutes of getting the vaccine she reported that her heart began to race and she became sweaty and uncomfortable. After another 5 minutes or so she began to have difficulty breathing as her chest and throat felt very tight and restricted. She also became lightheaded. Her heart rate was over 100, then dropped into the 70s, then shot back up over 100. Her face had a weird sensation as well. She was given Benadryl first and then epinephrine and had to go to the emergency room via ambulance for observation. She was released after an hour and had to take Benadryl every 6 hours for the next 24 hrs and diagnosed with an allergic reaction. On 12Jan2021, she had a hot flash upon waking up and felt generally under the weather all day. Her arm was very sore at the injection site. She missed a day of work due to the whole ordeal. On 13Jan2021, she felt more normal but still have some tightness in her chest with a fluttering feeling. The outcome of event diagnosed with an allergic reaction was not recovered; for other events was recovered. Information on the Lot/Batch Number has been requested.; Sender's Comments: Based on a compatible temporal association and known product safety profile, causality between event allergic reaction to vaccine and BNT162B2 cannot be excluded. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees and Investigators, as appropriate.

Bad cough; Trouble breathing; Tingling around mouth; Numbness in jaw and neck; Shaking; Red face and chest; Slight itching; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable healthcare professional (the patient). A 38-year-old non-pregnant female patient received the second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 MRNA VACCINE, Lot number EL8982), intramuscular in the left arm on 18Jan2021 at 10:30 (at the age of 38-years-old) as a single dose for Covid-19 immunization. Medical history was not reported. The patient was allergic to penicillin. The patient previously received dose 1 of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 MRNA VACCINE, Lot number EJ1685) on 28Dec2020 in the left arm. Prior to the vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. The patient's concomitant medications included levothyroxine (MANUFACTURER UNKNOWN) and cetirizine hydrochloride (ALERTEC), both for unknown indication from unknown dates and unknown if ongoing. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within four weeks prior to the vaccination. On 18Jan2021 at 11:00, the patient experienced bad cough, trouble breathing, tingling around mouth, numbness in jaw and neck, shaking, red face and chest, and slight itching. Treatment was given when seen by paramedics with an emergency room visit which included a second dose of allergy medication. The clinical outcome of the events bad cough, trouble breathing, tingling around mouth, numbness in jaw and neck, shaking, red face and chest, and slight itching was recovering. It was reported that since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19.; Sender's Comments: The reported events were likely causally related to the second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 MRNA VACCINE), considering the plausible temporal relationship and clinical course of the events. The case will be reassessed should additional information become available. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees and Investigators, as appropriate.

38 2021-02-09 shortness of breath With the second dose my symptoms started late evening on 01/13/2021. I started feeling bad, but fini... Read more
Close
With the second dose my symptoms started late evening on 01/13/2021. I started feeling bad, but finished my shift. Felt drained, headache to start. By next morning (01/14) I had fever (101.5F) and the whose body aches, nausea, diarrhea, horrible horrible headache, like a migraine, severe congestion, runny nose and some days later I started having an earache on my right ear. I would like to mention I also had a vaginal discharge with an unpleasant odor that started with the first dose and had not resolved by the time I received the second dose and this time the odor is much stronger, it is awful, I already made an appt with my GYN. The odor got much stronger about a week after the second dose. I kept self medicating at home with Tylenol, Ibuprofen, but the fever would return as soon as the dose was weaning off. The 101.5F fever lasted for about 9 days. I also experienced shortness of breath from 01/14 until the 22nd and I never had to use my rescue inhaler before. I had to use it and had to even call for a second one. I am very athletic and active and never need it even after my runs and workout activities. I consulted with my PCP on the 19th and again she gave me a covid test. Negative. She diagnosed me with inner ear infection (right ear). Prescribed me Levaquin and in 2 days I was much better. On the 22nd I finally started seeing the symptoms subside and started feeling better. Also, I wanted to tell that I had a gas pain episode that almost sent me to the ER. My chest, my left shoulder hurt really really bad. I called a friend who is a physician and he told me to take some gasex first and if that did not work to go to the ER. Fortunately it worked. But the pain was excruciating.

Close
Thursday started extreme fatigue, headache, muscle aches. On Sunday started rash on chest, arms and legs with itching in face and throat. Went to urgent care on Monday and received steroid cream for rash. Rash went away by Thursday, but came back on Saturday, then have had a light redness on and off since the following Sunday. Still had the fatigue, headache, muscles aches, but started the shortness of breath, chest pain with dry cough, nausea. Saw NP on Thursday and got prednisone for cough and shortness of breath. Felt better on Thursday but got worse over the weekend with increased shortness of breath, chest pain with cough and spotty vision. Saw NP on Monday and was sent to ER to rule out life threatening illnesses. Finished the prednisone on Monday.

38 2021-02-18 respiratory distress, shortness of breath, wheezing, throat tightness COVID VACCINE CLINIC Subjective Patient is a 38 y.o. female who was seen at COVID Vaccine Cli... Read more
Close
COVID VACCINE CLINIC Subjective Patient is a 38 y.o. female who was seen at COVID Vaccine Clinic today for her first dose of the COVID 19 vaccination. She was given the Pfizer vaccination in the left deltoid muscle. During her 30 min waiting period after the injection, the patient began to experience throat tightness and wheezy. She denied sob, cp, facial swelling, tongue swelling. She reports of above symptoms about 20 minutes after receiving vaccine. This provider was notified of patient reaction and she was then assessed in the emergency bay area. Monitored patient for severe reaction symptoms, including but not limited to abdominal pain, blood pressure abnormality , chest pain, drooling, hypotension, increased swelling, rapid progression of symptoms, respiratory distress, skin changes, tongue swelling and vomiting . PMH: Previous Reactions: allergies including anaphylaxis to shellfish, peanut oil and sulfa drugs. Reaction of arm swelling to location of shot and wheezy when she got the flu shot 7 years ago. Asthma hx. She had taken Singulair, cetirizine and albuterol prior to coming. She did not take any benadryl prior to her injection as pt reports that her sister whom is a nurse told her not to take benadryl in case it masks a reaction. ALLERGY REVIEW OF SYSTEMS: Patient complains of frequent throat clearing (slightly upon arrival. with throat itching) and wheezing Patient denies chills, fever, malaise/fatigue, facial swelling, itching in ears, sore throat, eyes watering, eyes itching, puffy eyes, eye redness, cough, chest tightness, shortness of breath, rash, hives, eczema, cysts, itching of skin, vomiting, abdominal pain, diarrhea, muscle aches, joint pain, dizziness and headaches Objective Vitals Vitals: 02/19/21 0933 02/19/21 0944 02/19/21 0952 02/19/21 1002 BP: (!) 143/83 134/81 126/80 123/70 Pulse: SpO2: 100% 100% 100% Physical Exam Constitutional: General: She is not in acute distress. Appearance: Normal appearance. She is not ill-appearing, toxic-appearing or diaphoretic. Comments: No facial or lip swelling HENT: Mouth/Throat: Lips: Pink. Mouth: Mucous membranes are moist. Pharynx: Oropharynx is clear. Uvula midline. No pharyngeal swelling, oropharyngeal exudate, posterior oropharyngeal erythema or uvula swelling. Eyes: General: Lids are normal. Extraocular Movements: Extraocular movements intact. Conjunctiva/sclera: Conjunctivae normal. Neck: Trachea: Trachea and phonation normal. Cardiovascular: Rate and Rhythm: Regular rhythm. Tachycardia present. Pulses: Normal pulses. Heart sounds: Normal heart sounds. Comments: Slightly tachycardia (103) Pulmonary: Effort: Pulmonary effort is normal. Breath sounds: Normal breath sounds and air entry. No stridor, decreased air movement or transmitted upper airway sounds. No decreased breath sounds, wheezing, rhonchi or rales. Comments: Speaking full sentences. Musculoskeletal: Cervical back: Full passive range of motion without pain. Skin: General: Skin is warm. Findings: No rash. Comments: Injection site w/o erythema or swelling. No adhesive reactions Neurological: General: No focal deficit present. Mental Status: She is alert. Psychiatric: Mood and Affect: Mood is anxious ( slightly). Thought Content: Thought content normal. Judgment: Judgment normal. Re-evaluation of lung sounds and throat was done periodically about every 5-10 minutes. No acute findings seen/heard. Assessment/Plan Treatment included: albuterol, antihistamines, water and solu-medrol IM and pepcid, albuterol (pt used her own). Follow up response to treatment: excellent. Scale of 0-10 based on symptoms of tightness was 7 at first. Upon discharge was 3-4/10. Patient discharge: Stable to go home and follow up with PCP and her allergist. Differential Diagnosis: Anaphylaxis/anxiety (dyspnea, stridor, drooling, tongue swelling) We discussed close monitoring at home and when/if she were to take her epi-pen and call 911 if symptoms were to worsen. She's to let her allergist know about her visit today. She may need to have other medications taken prior to her #2 dose of Pfizer according to her allergist recommendations. Pt appreciative and is ready to go home. Pt wheeled out to front door by security. Accompanied by husband.

38 2021-02-21 shortness of breath Chills, fatigue, hallucinations, shortness of breath, chest pain, and body aches
38 2021-02-22 shortness of breath Within 30 minutes, I turned bright red - my face and my forearms. Not a rash or raised rash. It was ... Read more
Close
Within 30 minutes, I turned bright red - my face and my forearms. Not a rash or raised rash. It was a deep red flushing. I took a dose of oral Benadryl it didn't go away. It felt like a sunburn. I had a headache starting at the back of my head. 1st and second day, I had pain in my joints. Not muscular pain. It came and went the joint pain - behind my left knee was hurting really bad and then it went away. Then my right wrist would start hurting and then it would go away, etc. The second day, the headache was more mild - like a mild pressure in my head. The redness was still there - the red face and red arms. My left arm at the site was cherry red and about the size of two inch circle and somewhat raised. The third day, my headache was worse. It was not like a normal headache but an overall pressure in head. Pink and a bit larger but didn't hurt as bad on arm- the redness continued for six days on my face. The headache lasted 14 days straight - Motrin, ice, heat and extra sleep was tried for treatment. On 15th day it started to let up. On 16th day, it was very mild headache. On the 17th day, it was a full blown headache again. Day 18 it was gone. On the second week, I had mild pain in my stomach and then that went away. On day 3, I had about an hour - twice that day - where I was short of breath and then it went away - it was just that day - about noon and at night. I took Benadryl and when I woke up that didn't happen again. Doctor called on day 12 - when my headaches weren't going away. He took some labs. My labs were normal except thyroid (and I already have a condition for my thyroid). Dr. gave me a medication for headache but I didn't take it - it had a possibility of making me tired and I didn't want to take it.
38 2021-02-24 wheezing COVID-19 Vaccine Pt received first dose of vaccine in December and states that she only had a sore ... Read more
Close
COVID-19 Vaccine Pt received first dose of vaccine in December and states that she only had a sore arm. She received second dose 1/13/2021 at 0813 and had no side effects. Around 1500, she developed chest pain and wheezing. She used her albuterol inhaler (pt has asthma), which helped. That night, she developed a sore arm. She woke 1/14/2021 around 0100-0200 from pain and was unable to go to back to sleep. She had aching in her left arm, as well as shooting pains through her arm and into palm. She took APAP 1000 mg PO x 1 and doxylamine which helped, but she was still unable to go back to sleep d/t pain. The pain expanded into her chest (especially with deep breaths), and upper back. She developed headache, sore throat, sweats and chills, shooting pain in her ear, painful and swollen left axillary lymph node, and the right side of her tongue became numb (numbness subsided after 1-2 hours). 1/14/21 morning, pt has persistent left hand pain, as well as joint pain in her feet, hips, and knees. She took another 1000 mg of APAP, which helped her pain. by 1/14 evening, she took 1000 mg APAP again and was able to sleep, although pt still endorsed sweats/chills. 1/15: Pt reports her pain is better, less severe, though now she is very fatigued and feels like she has been "hit by a truck". Her left axillary lymph node is still painful and swollen, but less painful than before.

Family Medicine Cosigned by: MD at 3/4/2021 8:26 AM Expand AllCollapse All Subjective Patient is a 38 y.o. female who was seen at clinic, COVID Vaccine Clinic today for her first dose of the COVID 19 vaccination. She was given the Pfizer vaccination in the left deltoid muscle. During her 15 minute waiting period after the injection, the patient began to experience lightheadedness, sob and diaphoresis. She denied rash, difficulty swallowing, wheezing, throat tightness, hoarseness, stridor, itching, facial swelling, lip swelling and tongue swelling. This provider was notified of patient reaction and she was then assessed in the emergency bay area. Monitored patient for severe reaction symptoms, including but not limited to blood pressure abnormality , collapse, hypotension, rapid progression of symptoms and respiratory distress. Pt wheeled back in wheelchair. She was pale diaphoretic with slow to response to questions. She was alert and oriented x 3. She was assisted by two nurses into the bed and placed in trendelenburg. ALLERGY REVIEW OF SYSTEMS: Patient complains of malaise/fatigue, shortness of breath and dizziness Patient denies facial swelling, sore throat, frequent throat clearing, cough, chest tightness, wheezing, rash, itching of skin, vomiting, abdominal pain, muscle aches and headaches Previous Reactions: none Objective Vitals Vitals: 02/26/21 1318 02/26/21 1333 02/26/21 1337 02/26/21 1405 BP: 100/64 117/70 115/76 112/59 BP Location: Left arm Patient Position: Trendelenburg Sitting Pulse: 66 SpO2: Blood Sugar 97 collected at 1313 Physical Exam Constitutional: General: She is in acute distress. Appearance: She is diaphoretic. Neck: Thyroid: No thyromegaly. Cardiovascular: Rate and Rhythm: Regular rhythm. Tachycardia present. Heart sounds: Normal heart sounds. Pulmonary: Effort: Tachypnea present. No respiratory distress. Breath sounds: Normal breath sounds. No wheezing. Musculoskeletal: Cervical back: Neck supple. Skin: General: Skin is warm. Neurological: Mental Status: She is alert, oriented to person, place, and time and easily aroused. Pt monitored closely by RN and this provider. Pt able to demonstrate improvement after being placed in trendelenburg position. Slowly in 5-10 min increments we raised her hob up and seen improvement. She was given water and snack. 01:55 pm: She was able to demonstrate ambulation around medical bay without assistance, dizziness/lightheadedness. Assessment/Plan Treatment included: water, snacks and body position, ice packs Follow up response to treatment: excellent. Patient discharge: Stable to go home and follow up with PCP. Differential Diagnosis: Systemic reaction (hypoglycemia, hypotension, generalized rash) She has recovered well after almost an hour of observation/intervention. VS stable, normotensive, normal heart rate and rhythm, dry skin, a &O x 4. She had a hypotensive response to the vaccine. Suggest that she lay down for her next vaccine out of precaution. She did eat a turkey sandwich prior to coming and had water as well. She is pleased with her care. She was walked out to the front with RN. HCP, APRN Electronically Signed 2/26/2021 1:32 PM

Close
On Wednesday, March 24, 2021 patient received her first dose of Pfizer COVID vaccine (LOT # ER2613, EXP 7/2021) at approximately 12:05pm. Patient has a history of Penicillin allergy and was to be observed for 30 minutes after administration of her vaccination. While in Observation Area, patient reported she felt a sensation of her "throat swelling" at 12:10pm and vitals were taken by EMTs. Vitals at 12:10pm: HR: 128bpm, 02 sat: 98%. Lead PHN was alerted and upon observation authorized EMT to administer 50mg of Diphenhydramine HCL oral solution per protocol with a water bottle at 12:15pm. BP at 12:16pm: 132/84. At 12:25pm, vitals were taken again shortly after and pulse returned to within normal limits, 94bpm, O2 sat: 99%. At 12:30pm: BP 140/78. At 12:40pm, patient reported the swelling in her throat had completely subsided. Patient was alert and oriented x4 during entire interaction. No further interventions indicated. Patient was educated by Lead RN & EMT on signs and symptoms of adverse reactions and when to go to the ED/call MD. Patient left vaccination site with a steady gait.

39 2021-01-03 shortness of breath Headache sweats body chills fever trouble breathing
39 2021-01-03 shortness of breath I developed immediate flushing, sweating, rapid heartbeat (was around 110bpm, is normally around 75b... Read more
Close
I developed immediate flushing, sweating, rapid heartbeat (was around 110bpm, is normally around 75bpm), and lightheadedness. I sat down and had a few sips of water. Within a few minutes, I felt like I was having a difficult time getting a good breath in. I raised my hands over my head and took slow deep breaths to try and keep my breathing under control. I stayed at the hospital for about 45 minutes, over which time I had a few bites to eat and some water. The flushing and sweating resolved within that time. The lightheadedness and "feeling of doom" lasted about 3 hours. I had no anxiety going into this vaccine, nor have I had a reaction like this before.

39 2021-01-05 shortness of breath 10 MINUTES after the injection, I became very hot and flushed, with headache, palpitations, weakness... Read more
Close
10 MINUTES after the injection, I became very hot and flushed, with headache, palpitations, weakness, and shortness of breath. I sat down, my heart rate was 110 on my I watch. I was breathing heavy and feeling sweaty. The healthcare providers had me lie down on a stretcher and gave me oxygen with my feet elevated. After about 20 minutes, I felt better. Later that day, I came home and slept for 2 hours. The next day, (today) I came home early from work because I feel very tired and having difficulty concentrating. But the other symptoms have gone away.

Close
blood pressure went up to 150/101; feeling like fainting; feeling really tired; Weakness; irregular heart beat; sob; feeling like flushing in the body; chills; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable healthcare professional. A 39-year-old female patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: EL1284), intramuscular on the left arm on 30Dec2020 07:15 at single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included hypothyroidism, depression, cardiac murmur and pvc. The patient hadno known drug allergies and had not tested for COVID-19 prior and after vaccination. Concomitant medication included levothyroxine sodium (SYNTHROID), ergocalciferol (VITAMIN D), tocopherol (VITAMIN E) and sertraline hydrochloride (ZOLOFT). The patient experienced weakness, irregular heart beat, feeling like fainting, sob, blood pressure went up to 150/101, feeling like flushing in the body, chills, feeling really tired, all on 30Dec2020 07:15. The patient received treatment. The outcome of the events was recovering.; Sender's Comments: Based on the close temporal relationship, the association between the event "blood pressure went up to 150/101" with BNT162b2 can not fully excluded. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to regulatory authorities, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate.

Close
heart rate spiked; difficult to catch breath; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable healthcare professional. A 39-year-old female patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE; Lot number: EK5730), via an unspecified route of administration in the right arm, on 18Dec2020 (at the age of 39-years-old) at a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included Hashimoto's thyroiditis, depression, acid reflux, and COVID-19 (prior to vaccination). The patient has no known allergies. The patient was not pregnant at the time of vaccination. Concomitant medications, within two weeks prior to vaccination, included sertraline (MANUFACTURER UNKNOWN), omeprazole (MANUFACTURER UNKNOWN), liothyronine sodium (T3), and levothyroxine sodium (T4). The patient experienced heart rate spiked and difficult to catch breath on 20Dec2020. The events were reported as non-serious. The clinical course was reported as follows: In Dec2020, the heart rate spiked to 194 when running outside and it was difficult to catch breath, so the patient ran/walked the 3 mile route. The heart rate spiked to 183 during a strength training workout and to 148 during a low impact weight training, which is unusual for the patient (as reported). The patient did not receive any treatment for the events. The clinical outcome of heart rate spiked and difficult to catch breath was recovered in Dec2020. It was also reported that since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19.

Close
Metalic taste feeling of numbness in face with itching started within 25 min. I self medicated with 25mg of Benadryl 15 min before injection because I had the same reaction to the first injection. However it did not prevent the reaction as I hoped it would this time. 30 min post injection I took another 25mg of Benadryl. Once med started working symptoms went away. At no time did I have difficulty breathing. By midnight I was woken by chills, body aches, and head ache (possibly secondary to the jaw clenching I woke up with too). I took tylenol which did not appear to help which is abnormal for me. Fever, chills, aches continued on throughout the night and through the day into the night. On tylenol fever was noted to be 100.6 Fahrenheit. I was finally able to sleep with tylenol and motrin by 10 pm on 18th for 8 hours. Next day temp was about 97.6 Fahrenheit with mild sweating throughout the day and aches had subsided. Today Jan. 19th all symptoms are gone.

39 2021-01-27 asthma, shortness of breath Exactly 12 hours after the shot, I experienced what I expected: 103 degree fever, body aches, joint ... Read more
Close
Exactly 12 hours after the shot, I experienced what I expected: 103 degree fever, body aches, joint aches, chills. Those symptoms wore off exactly 25 hours after I had received my second vaccine. But the next day, my asthma got terrible. Over the course of the next week, I was on my steroid inhaler twice a day, and on my nebulizer 4-5 times a day just to breathe. After about 5 days of not getting better, my doctor prescribed me liquid steroids to put in my nebulizer so that they would just target my lungs and not impact the efficacy of the vaccine. Several days later, I was still not better. At that point, I was 12 days out from the second shot. He then ordered me oral steroids that I would taper. After about 3 days without any improvement, he told me to hold at 20 mg of oral prednisone in addition to my steroid inhaler and steroid nebulizer solution. I am now 21 days out from the second shot, and my asthma has not improved. My lungs have had severe inflammation for three weeks now.

By 9AM body aches, headache, cough, chills. Fever went down on Thursday 100.8F, hot and cold sweats. I never felt like that before. I also had some GI issues (diarrhea) and a little bit of shortness of breath, just by walking to the restroom I would be very fatigued and when I checked my oxygen it would drop to 88% just by walking from my bed to the bathroom (Wednesday and Thursday was the worst). I still have fatigue and my throat hurts a little bit, I have congestion again and I started feverish again this Tuesday and lots of cough. Low grade fever (99.9F). My employee health told me to not return due to my symptoms until they subside or go get checked. Coughing and sneezing restarted yesterday. I had returned to work on Monday but then by Tuesday symptoms started reappearing.

A 39-years-old non-pregnant female patient received the first dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: EL3247, expiration date: unknown), intramuscular on the left arm on 30Dec2020 at 15:00 at a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included gastroparesis, low thyroid, iron anemia, and known allergies: latex, apples, kiwi and avocado. Concomitant medications included bifidobacterium infantis (ALIGN), colecalciferol (VITAMIN D [COLECALCIFEROL]), cetirizine hydrochloride (ZYRTEC [CETIRIZINE HYDROCHLORIDE]), duloxetine hydrochloride (CYMBALTA), ethinylestradiol, ferrous fumarate, norethisterone acetate (LO LOESTRIN FE), folic acid (FOLIC ACID), levothyroxine (LEVOTHYROXINE), omeprazole (OMEPRAZOLE), and pantoprazole (PANTOPRAZOLE). The patient had no other vaccine in four weeks. On 30Dec2020, the patient experienced (first shot) fever, dizziness, aching joints, headache, shortness of breath, swollen and painful lymph nodes in left armpit only, 24 hours after the shot and lasted for two weeks. The patient had no COVID prior vaccination and tested negative post-vaccination through nasal swab on 13Jan2021, which resulted negative. No treatment was administered for the events. The event swollen and painful lymph nodes in left armpit only resolved on 14Jan2021 while the rest of the events had not resolved. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested.

very dizzy; shortness of breath; fever; aching joints; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable healthcare professional (the patient). A 39-year-old female patient received the second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 MRNA VACCINE, lot number EL3247), intramuscular in the left arm on 20Jan2021 at 13:45 (at the age of 39-years-old) as a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included gastroparesis, low thyroid, iron anemia; and allergies to latex, apples, kiwi, and avocado. The patient did not have COVID prior to vaccination. The patient had a nasal swab COVID test on 13Jan2021, which was negative. The patient was not pregnant at the time of vaccination. Concomitant medications included: omeprazole, pantoprazole, levothyroxine, ethinylestradiol/ ferrous fumarate/ norethisterone acetate (LO LOESTRIN FE), bifidobacterium infantis (ALIGN), cetirizine hydrochloride (ZYRTEC ALLERGY), duloxetine hydrochloride (CYMBALTA), folic acid, and colecalciferol (VITAMIN D). The patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 MRNA VACCINE), intramuscular on 30Dec2020 at 15:00 (at the age of 39-years-old), in the left arm as a single dose for COVID-19 immunization, and experienced fever, dizziness, aching joints, headache, shortness of breath, swollen and painful lymph nodes in left armpit only, 24 hours after shot, lasted two weeks. The patient had not received any other vaccine within 4 weeks prior to the vaccine. In Jan2021, the patient experienced very dizzy, shortness of breath, fever, and aching joints about 8 hours after the shot. The patient did not receive any treatment for the events. The clinical outcome of very dizzy, shortness of breath, fever, and aching joints about 8 hours after the shot was not recovered.

Close
body aches; She feels like she has shortness of breath; feeling really tired/fatigued; chills and sweats; chills and sweats; sore at injection site; lost sense of smell; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 39-years-old female patient received first dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Batch/lot number: EN5318), intramuscular in left deltoid on 23Jan2021 15:35 at SINGLE DOSE for covid-19 immunisation. She typically got sick when she got the flu vaccine or any vaccine in general for immunization, she got deathly sick. She always got the flu after getting the flu vaccine. She did not get the flu shot this year and she did not get the flu. She did not know the name of the flu vaccine or any vaccine that she was referring to and she did not have lot number to provide. Other medical history was reported as none. There were no concomitant medications. Relevant Tests were reported as none. The patient experienced lost sense of smell on 23Jan2021 with outcome of not recovered, feeling really tired on 24Jan2021 with outcome of not recovered, chills and sweats on 24Jan2021 with outcome of recovered on 25Jan2021, sore at injection site on 24Jan2021 with outcome of not recovered, body aches and Shortness of breath on an unspecified date with outcome unknown. Details were as follows: the patient had a list of the expected side effects and she did not see loss of sense of smell on the list. Reported she completely lost her sense of smell, she cannot smell anything at all. She was asking if she should be concerned. On Friday prior to getting the vaccine she could smell everything. She thought the loss of smell started Sunday, reported it may have started Saturday (23Jan2021). She noticed when she put her body spray on Sunday and she was washing her hands that she could not smell. She can taste fine. She can handle the body aches and all the other stuff. She clarifies she was experiencing body aches, she was feeling really tired, fatigued. She was feeling better. She could not call earlier because she was so tired. She had the chills and sweats that started Sunday evening and recovered today (25Jan2021). Reported her sheets were drenched with sweat when she woke up. She did not have a fever. She thought most of her side effects started Sunday night. Reported the injection site was sore and that started the day after receiving her injection, it was still sore. She did not go to work today (25Jan2021). She felt like she had shortness of breath but she was checking her oxygen level and it was fine, stated it just felt like she was short of breath and it was ongoing and persisting. No additional vaccines Administered on Same Date. The events did not require a visit to Emergency Room and Physician Office.
39 2021-02-10 throat tightness Patient received her 1st dose of Pfizer vaccine around 1810 on 2/9. Approximately 10-15 mins later h... Read more
Close
Patient received her 1st dose of Pfizer vaccine around 1810 on 2/9. Approximately 10-15 mins later her arm was shaking uncontrollably, she felt that her throat was closing and had chest pressure. Medics noted hives and a rash on her chest and administered Epi and Benadryl. She began exhibiting stroke-like symptoms of expressive aphasia and dysarthria in the medic?s truck around 1850. She was crying and unable to speak. She had right sided facial droop, right sided grip weakness, and right sided arm drift. Patient was transferred to MC. Patient Update: Patient received tPA on 2/9 at 1949. CT revealed no hemorrhage or large territory stroke and no large vessel occlusion. NIHSS on admission to MC was a 3. Patient was also assessed by speech pathology. Patient appears to have been discharged home on 2/10. Patient to follow up with Outpatient Neuro PT Rehab as she is having some issues with mobility, gait, and overall functional mobility. She is using a 2 wheeled walker at this time.
39 2021-02-11 shortness of breath I got a strange vision/hallucination; rapid and hard heartbeat; shortness of breath; nausea; headach... Read more
Close
I got a strange vision/hallucination; rapid and hard heartbeat; shortness of breath; nausea; headache; had nightmares all night; stiff, sore arm; stiff, sore arm; my arm has a bumpy, red mild rash at and around injection site; my arm has a bumpy, red mild rash at and around injection site; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer, the patient. A 39-year-old female patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 MRNA VACCINE, Lot number EN5318), via an unspecified route of administration on 26Jan2021 at 14:45 (at the age of 39 years) as a single dose in the right arm for COVID-19 vaccination. Medical history included fatty liver. The patient had no known allergies. Prior to the vaccination, the patient was diagnosed with COVID-19 on an unspecified date. Concomitant medications were not reported. The patient reported that on 27Jan2021 at 12:30 AM, approximately ten hours after the vaccine, the patient experienced a rapid and hard heartbeat, shortness of breath, nausea and headache. These lasted for one and one half hours. As she lay down falling asleep she got a strange vision/hallucination (this had never happened to her before) of her eyes turning lightning blue and her body rising up in the bed. She stated that she does not take medications or drugs and does not have a history of mental illness. She could not shake the vision. She fell asleep and had nightmares all night and nightmares are rare for her. One day two she woke up fine just a stiff, sore arm. On day three her arm has a bumpy, red mild rash at and around injection site. The patient did not receive any treatment for the events. Lab data included a COVID SARS CoV-2 positive test on an unspecified date. The clinical outcomes of hallucination, heart rate increased, shortness of breath, nausea, headache, nightmares, pain in arm, limb stiffness and vaccination site rash were reported as recovering. It was also reported that since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19.

I immediately reported my symptoms to the MD that was in the room monitoring the recent vaccinated employees. Immediately he administered 50mg of Benadryl, 20mg of Pepcid, and salbutamol. I was rushed to the ED and stayed there for couple of hours headed back to my unit and then sent home by my manager.

Close
01/09/21, 25 minutes after I got my 2nd dose, I felt heart palpitation. I my heart rate was 109 at sitting. I feel my heart beats stronger than normal. my heart palpitation didn't improve overnight. 01/10/21 I feel shortness of breath with talking and walking. My chest hurts. My head hurst. I call my hospital and talked to an RN urgent line. She suggested me to go to Urgent Care or ER. I went to Urgent Care at 1500 that day. At check in my blood pressure was 160/110 (my normal BP is around 120/90 or less) heart rate was 112. EKG was done, result no concern. Urgent Care Doctor sent me home with no medication. He said what I experienced is the reaction of my body with the Covid vaccine. He told me to go to ER if my symptoms get worse. I went and see my primary doctor ( bloods tests was done ) and Cardiologist after with EKG and ECHO done. I was off from work during that time. I feel back to normal after 10 days.

did not have full anaphylaxis; a sense of her throat swelling; hives; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable physician. A 39-year-old female patient received first dose of bnt162b2 (Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine), via an unspecified route of administration on an unspecified date at a single dose for covid-19 immunisation. The patient's medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. On an unspecified date, it was reported that the patient experienced "a sense of her throat swelling" and hives 1 hour after the vaccination occurred. The patient received 1 dose of Benadryl and Tylenol and "felt ok." The physician commented that the patient did not have full anaphylaxis and was asking if it would be safe for the patient to receive the second dose of the vaccine at the time of report. The outcome of the events was recovering. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested.

felt almost like fainting; felt like she was drowning especially when going to sleep; chest tightness/felt tightness in her chest; She couldn't take a deep breath.; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable physician. A 39-years-old female patient received the first dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE) , via an unspecified route of administration on an unspecified date at single dose for covid-19 immunisation. The patient medical history was not reported. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. The patient received the 1st dose of the PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE and experienced chest tightness. Patient started to experience this symptom the day after she got the 1st dose - Experiencing chest tightness/feeling of drowning especially when laying down to bed daily - No history of cough, fever, anxiety, depression. The patient got the shot during the first 10 to 15 minutes she felt almost like fainting, but she didn't. Patient was keep for 15 to 20 minutes after receiving the vaccine to monitor. The feeling didn't last long. The first ten days after the vaccine the patient felt tightness in her chest for no reason. In the patient's medical history, there is no history of asthma or reactive airway disease or anxiety or depression. For a total of 10 days the patient felt like she was drowning especially when going to sleep. She couldn't take a deep breath. She didn't have to seek medical attention or go to the ER. The outcome of events was unknown. Information on lot number/batch number has been requested.
39 2021-03-10 shortness of breath Approximately 2.5 hours after injection, a fiery pain started at the injection site, went up to the ... Read more
Close
Approximately 2.5 hours after injection, a fiery pain started at the injection site, went up to the shoulder, and down the left side of my chest. This was accompanied by chest tightening and slight shortness of breath. The pain ended after about a minute while I was getting my phone to call an ambulance because it was so bad. I chose not to complete the call as the pain began to fade. The chest tightening and breathing issue resolved a couple minutes later. My arm was extremely painful the rest of the day (achy, not the fiery sensation). I have never had a reaction like this to any vaccine or medication.
39 2021-03-10 throat tightness On March 3, 2021, a eligible vaccine recipient, patient, received her first dose of Pfizer Covid 19 ... Read more
Close
On March 3, 2021, a eligible vaccine recipient, patient, received her first dose of Pfizer Covid 19 vaccine at approximately 9:00am. After a 15 minute observation period, patient was driving home at approximately 9:20am when she began to feel tingling and numbness in her mouth and tightening of the throat. Patient returned to clinic and informed clinic staff she was having a reaction to the vaccine. A cardiologist volunteering in the post-immunization observation met with the patient and evaluated her. The cardiologist was informed by patient that she had a history of allergic reactions to vaccines and carries an EpiPen, but had not used it yet. Patient's vitals were normal. She was given diphenhydramine for her symptoms, which did not improve. The Emergency Department was consulted, who advised that patient should be transported to the ED and monitored for 4 hours. The cardiologist transported patient to ED via wheelchair. The following day, patient reported she was released from the ED after 4 hours of observation. All of the symptoms had subsided at the time of release from the ED, and she was back to baseline on 3/4/21. The patient was referred to an allergist for consultation and clearance prior to receiving a second dose of Pfizer vaccine. Also of note, upon review of the patient's vaccine consent form, she did not acknowledge that she had previous anaphylactic reactions to other vaccines, nor was this information relayed to the vaccinator who administered the vaccine. Upon return to clinic, the patient reported she was 5-6 weeks pregnant.

Close
Tingling in lips and tongue. Raspy voice. Some shortness of breath and chest pain. Pt reported hx of asthma and pt took a breathing treatment of albuterol. No tongue swelling, rash, or airway closure reported.

After about 18 minutes (patient under observation for 30 minutes) the patient started to complain of itching on face, arms, and swelling feeling in mouth. she also c/o shortness of breath. On observation her oxygen saturation and blood pressure remained stable. she was brought into the office from the waiting area and given 25 mg benadryl IM. SHe was observed for 15 minutes and vitals were monitored and remained stable. she subsequently continued to have itching in throat and around mouth and hives were noted on arms and neck. her lips appeared starting to have edema. She was given one dose of epipen 0.3mg im in thigh and 911 was called. she was transported to er for further treatment and observation. she reported to us several hours later that she remained stable and was discharged on prednisone, famotidine, and cetirizine.

Close
Had sore arm for first two days. On the third day started getting palpitations and racing heart. This came and went and woke me up in the middle of the night and early morning several times. Today is day 10 and I was prescribed a 24 hour holter monitor. In the last 3 days I've had several episodes of facial nerve pain in my jaw and teeth, numbness in my face and also pins and needles in various parts of my body. Sore and painful spot to the touch under left ribs. Extreme palpitations and heart racing that make me feel like Im going to pass out, sudden pressure on the left side of my neck and ear heartbeat in my left ear during these episodes, trouble breathing , pain and tingling in upper left chest and coughing that goes away in about 30 minutes. Each episode ends with uncontrollable urge to sleep. Almost feels like an intense food allergy reaction but it happens on a completely empty stomach. They seem to be getting progressively worse
39 2021-03-23 throat tightness, shortness of breath Post-shot in the waiting room ----Within minutes my throat began to close and it became hard to swal... Read more
Close
Post-shot in the waiting room ----Within minutes my throat began to close and it became hard to swallow. Once i removed my mask for better breathing, chest became tight and swallowing became extremely difficult. Breathing quickly became challenging. I flagged attendant about my symptoms then quickly rushed to the back patient room. I explained this reaction is similar to an asthma attack - and attempted to use my recuse inhaler. I used my rescue inhaler about 6-8 times. I was offered water and to sit down to focus on breathing. Breathing returned to normal after waiting the full 30mins. I immediately scheduled a follow-up with my PCP to discuss my experience.

Systemic: Allergic: Difficulty Breathing-Mild, Systemic: Allergic: Difficulty Swallowing, Throat Tightness-Mild, Systemic: Allergic: Itch (specify: facial area, extremeties)-Medium
39 2021-03-23 throat swelling Systemic: throat/tonsils slightly swollen-Mild
39 2021-03-24 throat swelling She reported a previous reaction to initial Pfizer dose: complained of left facial numbness/tingling... Read more
Close
She reported a previous reaction to initial Pfizer dose: complained of left facial numbness/tingling as well as flushing, she also reported facial swelling. She was treated with Benadryl 25mg PO. She was unable to make an appointment with allergy/immunology prior to obtaining this dose. She received the dose and was given a 30-minute observation time. While in observation, I spoke to patient and she reported right-sided facial numbness and tingling but no flushing or swelling. She was otherwise feeling fine. Approx 10 minutes after injection, she complained of difficulty swallowing and mild throat swelling. Pulse was 110, O2 was 98% on room air. She denied SOB, wheezing. No stridor was noted and oropharyngeal exam was normal, no swelling or erythema noted. At this point, Benadryl liquid 50mg was given. After another 15 minutes of direct observation, her swallowing had improved and she felt stable to go home. Her pulse was 82, O2 98%. Suggested that they keep Benadryl at home, she can use every 6 hours as needed. If symptoms worsen, seek higher level of care. Patient and partner stated understanding.
39 2021-03-26 shortness of breath 10 minutes after receiving covid vaccine, rapid heart rate, hard to breathe, and metallic taste in ... Read more
Close
10 minutes after receiving covid vaccine, rapid heart rate, hard to breathe, and metallic taste in mouth. Advised to go to emergency after been checked out by allergist on site. At emergency, was given Pepcid, steroids, IV fluids, Benadryl intravenously. Also, did bloodwork and chest X-ray. After bloodwork came back, doctor felt okay to release me. Over the week, still felt heavy chested and I could not return to work until a week later. The emergency doctor, sent me home with steroids, Pepcid, and Benadryl to take for the next 3 days. I only took the steroids and Pepcid because the Benadryl made me feel so out of it. I also started to get fatigued couple days after with some body aches. On Saturday morning, I woke up at 4:00 am to vomit. Had an appointment with my PCP that Monday, told me to take Claritin and Albuetrol inhaler.
39 2021-03-26 mild apnea Patient experienced severe muscle cramping and spasms around her chest and back. Intensity severe a... Read more
Close
Patient experienced severe muscle cramping and spasms around her chest and back. Intensity severe and affected the depths of breaths she could take. Received vaccination around 11:00 AM and went to ER around 3:00 PM. Blood work and EKG were normal. Received methocarbamol and Prilosec. Symptoms resolved in 48 hrs. Not believed to be an allergic reaction.
39 2021-03-26 shortness of breath SOB, BP 161/105 (pulse 96). F/u BP 144/96 (pulse 79).
39 2021-03-27 throat tightness feels like throat closing up, chest pressure, EMS evaluated, transported to ER
39 2021-03-30 shortness of breath Anaphylactic reaction (I could not swallow, I was short of breath, I got 2 bruises on my face, nause... Read more
Close
Anaphylactic reaction (I could not swallow, I was short of breath, I got 2 bruises on my face, nausea, tachycardia) at the first dose of the Pfizer vaccine, which I was treated immediately in the emergency room with Epinephrine, Benadryl, Decadron y Albuterol. I was discharged the same day. I was treated in observation at hospital.
39 2021-04-01 wheezing, throat tightness Throat fullness/tightness, heart racing, hot feeling, chest tightness and wheezing approximately 26 ... Read more
Close
Throat fullness/tightness, heart racing, hot feeling, chest tightness and wheezing approximately 26 to 27 minutes or so after the vaccine
39 2021-04-09 fluid in lungs, shortness of breath Brain cancer; thought she had a stroke; Possible progression of her lung cancer; Pain in the right s... Read more
Close
Brain cancer; thought she had a stroke; Possible progression of her lung cancer; Pain in the right side under the ribcage muscle in the serratus anterior muscle; Pain in the right side under the ribcage muscle in the serratus anterior muscle; Cough got worse and it was productive; Stress urinary incontinence; Extreme bone and muscle pain spanning over left upper torso; Pain in the right side under the ribcage muscle in the serratus anterior muscle; Felt weird; Anxiety; Pleural effusion; Enlarged lymph node; Started with a little cough, which progressively got worse; Could not take a deep breath; This is a spontaneous report received from a contactable physician (patient herself). A 39 year old female patient received first dose of BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Formulation: Solution for injection, Lot number: EN6201,Expiry date: Unknown) via intramuscular in right deltoid on 01Mar2021 as a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. The patient previously first dose of BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Formulation: Solution for injection, Lot number: EN6201, Expiry date: Unknown) via intramuscular in left deltoid on 01Feb2021 as a single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient's medical history included ongoing lung cancer from 03Jul2017, metastatic disease from lung cancer from: Dec 2018 and hypertension from: 2007. Concomitant medication included Losartan at 100 mg once a day tablet for blood pressure, Atorvastatin at 80 mg a day tablet for cholesterol, Lorbrena from 26Jun2019 at 100 mg once a day tablet for lung cancer, vitamin D3 at 3000 IU once a day gel cap and coq10 supplement at 100mg and all the drugs were ongoing. The patient did not receive any vaccination 4 weeks prior to the vaccination. No AEs (adverse events) following prior vaccination. The patient started feeling better around 27Feb2021. The patient was a cancer patient, and took marijuana and CBD which helps her sleep. The patient had pain in the serratus anterior the next morning 08Feb2021 and by the 11Feb2021 she had the massive bone and muscle pain spanning over left upper torso and lasted for about 3 weeks. The patient medicated herself with CBD and marijuana tincture and she would occasionally take Ibuprofen. The patient was thinking COVID vaccine can cause a variety of things. The patient got the second dose on 01Mar2021 in her right arm. The morning after the patient got her vaccine, experienced pain in the right side under the ribcage muscle in the serratus anterior muscle. As a treatment drug the patient received Tylenol and felt it masked the pain and was fine and still a little sore in the muscular distribution which was on and off mildly sore, not bad and states that the patient recovered with lasting effects. The patient started to have a slight cough, that the patient not had a cough in over a year and a half due to lung cancer and did not think it was lung cancer. The cough first time started to get a little worse, and that day was very cold and when the patient tried to walk around her boyfriends house and started jogging, the patient could not take a deep breath and could not expand ribcage because there was immense pain on 06Mar2021. As a treatment therapy the patient received some CBD and went to sleep, and this lasted about 2 days and after that it got a little better. The patient was improved but had slight lasting effects. The patient experienced cough the whole next week which got worse and was so bad and it was productive. The patient had stress urinary incontinence and was back on her pee pads that she had not been on for years. The patient palpated her left arm pit and felt an enlarged lymph node on Saturday 13Mar2021. On 15Mar2021 the patient would be two weeks since the patient was fully vaccinated and have seen reports that the vaccine causes lymphadenopathy. The patient found the lymph node and called her oncologist because she was worried about the worsening cough. The patient also reached to a Nurse Practitioner and the only thing that worried her was the cough, that she has not seen this in the data so far. The Nurse Practitioner sent her to have a chest x-ray on 18Mar2021 and it showed pleural effusion and fluid in her pleural space around her lungs. The patient had a thoracentesis 19Mar2021 to drain the fluid and they tested it and it was cancer. The patient seems to her there was a correlation with getting the COVID vaccine. On 22Mar2021, the patient got CT Scans of progression in her body and states the pleural effusion had been drained and was less but was still there. The patient felt weird all weekend and thought it was the thoracentesis that caused her anxiety and on 23Mar2021 and had neurological symptoms and thought that the patient had a stroke or something because she has had that in the past. The patient was all related to her lung cancer. The patient called her neuro oncologist and they said to go to ER (emergency room) on 23Mar2021. The patient had newfound brain cancer, and it was worsening, that it was only found Tuesday. The patient underwent brain MRI on 23Mar2021. This was new worsening disease, before it was stable and not getting worse or better, it was not active in the brain and felt a little nervous all the side effects after she got it. The outcome of the event Extreme bone and muscle pain spanning over left upper torso, Pain in the right side under the ribcage muscle in the serratus anterior muscle was recovering and the outcome of all the other events was unknown. No follow-up attempts are possible. No further information is expected.; Sender's Comments: Based on available information, the reported events are assessed as unrelated to BNT162b2 and can be attributed to intercurrent conditions in this patient with underlying lung cancer, metastatic disease from lung cancer and other comorbidities. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees and Investigators, as appropriate.
39 2021-04-12 fluid in lungs Pulmonary Embolism. Pain began in right side rib area on Saturday March 6th. Went to the ER on March... Read more
Close
Pulmonary Embolism. Pain began in right side rib area on Saturday March 6th. Went to the ER on March 7th late evening. Elevated D-dimer test warranted a CT scan. Scan showed Pulmonary Embolism.
39 2021-04-14 shortness of breath, exercise-induced asthma I began feeling short of breath after doing minor tasks in my own (doing laundry, walking up steps, ... Read more
Close
I began feeling short of breath after doing minor tasks in my own (doing laundry, walking up steps, etc.) during the 2nd week after my covid vaccination. On the morning of April 10th I awoke to feeling severely winded as if I had run 18 marathons just to walk up 3 steps or to walk across a room. I was taken to the ER where they performed a catscan on me and could see that my lungs were ?full? of blood clots and I was experiencing a pulmonary embolism. I do not smoke, take birth control pills, I do not drink. There is no family history of clotting, nor did any traumatic incident happen within the last two weeks to cause this.
39 2021-04-14 wheezing I immediately felt dizzy, like I was drunk. At around 4pm, I started feeling wheezy. It felt like th... Read more
Close
I immediately felt dizzy, like I was drunk. At around 4pm, I started feeling wheezy. It felt like there was a mastiff sitting on my chest. I took some benadryl, which helped. The next day, the feeling persisted and I had a mild cough, especially while lying down. More benadryl. Same on the third day. I did not seek medical attention because I didn't think it was an extraordinary reaction and I have had much worse reactions to other things in the past that have been managed with benadryl. I thought what I was experiencing was an expected side effect based on the information I had been given. The feeling started to ease by the 4th day, but then the insomnia, mood swings, exhaustion and body aches set in. The cough was sporadic, but still present. Today, I still get the heavy chest feeling intermittently, activity doesn't seem to have any effect or cause. My arm still itches at the injection site and hurts when touched. I went back to get my second dose on 4/9. When the nurse asked me if I had had any adverse reactions to the first one, I told her about the chest heaviness and coughing and the other symptoms. She stopped what she was doing and called her medical director. They both decided that the first response was enough of an anaphylactic reaction to be a caution for the second. They refused to give me the second dose because they thought the second would elicit a much worse reaction - possibly to the point of intubation. They told me that I would have to be evaluated by a physician and that I would need a "doctor's note" in order to get the second vaccine.
39 2021-04-14 throat tightness Large red ring around the injection site still there after 48 hours, severe chills, headache and bod... Read more
Close
Large red ring around the injection site still there after 48 hours, severe chills, headache and body aches, tingling mouth and some tightness of throat immediately after injection
39 2021-04-15 blood clot in lung, shortness of breath 50 hours after receiving vax shortness of breath and found blood clotting in lungs and legs
39 2021-04-24 blood clot in lung, shortness of breath pulmonary embolism; blood clots, her lungs were "full" of blood clots; trouble breathing; could bare... Read more
Close
pulmonary embolism; blood clots, her lungs were "full" of blood clots; trouble breathing; could barely walk up; This is a spontaneous report from contactable consumer. A 39-year-old female patient received the first dose of BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE) via an unspecified route of administration on 25Mar2021 at 11:00AM in left arm at single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Relevant medical history included minor thalassemia. Past drug history included buprenorphine (SUBLOCADE) taken on 10Mar2021 (location = stomach). Concomitant medications included venlafaxine and zolpidem. The patient had not COVID prior vaccination. The patient began to feel winded doing the most menial of tasks starting the week of 05Apr2021. On the morning of 10Apr2021 she woke up having trouble breathing after walking 10 steps to the bathroom. She could barely walk up 3 steps. It was as if she ran 10 marathons just to get to her bedroom on the second floor (as reported). She went to the ER where a CT scan was performed and it was found that she had a pulmonary embolism and her lungs were "full" of blood clots. Onset date for the events was reported as 07Apr2021 at 02:00PM. The events were serious as life-threatening (immediate risk of death from the event) and as causing hospitalization (for 4 days). Procedure to remove clots and heparin were given as treatments. The patient underwent COVID test (nasal swab) post vaccination on 10Apr2021 and result was negative. The events were resolving at the time of report. Information on Lot/Batch number has been requested.
39 2021-04-28 throat swelling Swollen and sore throat. Difficulty swallowing Congestion, pain in ears, and mild cough

Close
The left side of my face felt numb starting after the first hour and for the whole day. Also, my throat was slightly tightening; The left side of my face felt numb starting after the first hour and for the whole day. Also, my throat was slightly tightening; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable Nurse (Patient, self-reported). A 39-years-old not pregnant female patient received first dose of ( COVID-19 VACCINE, Solution for injection, Batch/Lot number was not reported), via an unspecified route of administration on 29 Jan 2021 09:15AM as an unspecified dose for covid-19 immunisation. Medical history included hypothyroid, known allergies was No. Concomitant medications included levothyroxine sodium (SYNTHROID); aspirin [acetylsalicylic acid], vitamins. On 29 Jan 2021 10:00, the patient experienced the left side of my face felt numb starting after the first hour and for the whole day. also, my throat was slightly tightening. Treatment received for the evets was unknown. The clinical outcome of the event was recovered on unspecified date of 2021. Information about lot/batch number has been requested. Follow-up (16 Apr 2021): This follow-up is being submitted to notify that the lot/batch number is not available despite the follow-up attempts made. Follow-up attempts have been completed and no further information is expected.
39 2021-05-09 throat tightness Tongue swelled and throat felt tight about 30 minutes after the shot. I immediately went back into ... Read more
Close
Tongue swelled and throat felt tight about 30 minutes after the shot. I immediately went back into the clinic at Hospital to report my reaction to a nurse. The nurse sent me to the ER to be monitored and receive Benadryl since my reaction wasn?t worsening. My tongue and feeling in my throat improved with their care.
